content: 9 Help us, God of our salvation, for the glory of your name. Deliver us, and forgive our sins, for your name’s sake.

title: Psalms 79:10
content: 10 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let it be known among the nations, before our eyes, that vengeance for your servants’ blood is being poured out.

title: Psalms 79:11
content: 11 Let the sighing of the prisoner come before you. According to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are sentenced to death.

title: Psalms 79:12
content: 12 Pay back to our neighbors seven times into their bosom their reproach with which they have reproached you, Lord.

title: Psalms 79:13
content: 13 So we, your people and sheep of your pasture, will give you thanks forever. We will praise you forever, to all generations.

title: Psalms 80:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “The Lilies of the Covenant.” A Psalm by Asaph. Hear us, Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock, you who sit above the cherubim, shine out.

title: Psalms 80:2
content: 2 Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your might! Come to save us!

title: Psalms 80:3
content: 3 Turn us again, God. Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.

title: Psalms 80:4
content: 4 LORD God of Armies, how long will you be angry against the prayer of your people?

title: Psalms 80:5
content: 5 You have fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink in large measure.

title: Psalms 80:6
content: 6 You make us a source of contention to our neighbors. Our enemies laugh among themselves.

title: Psalms 80:7
content: 7 Turn us again, God of Armies. Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.

title: Psalms 80:8
content: 8 You brought a vine out of Egypt. You drove out the nations, and planted it.

title: Psalms 80:9
content: 9 You cleared the ground for it. It took deep root, and filled the land.

title: Psalms 80:10
content: 10 The mountains were covered with its shadow. Its boughs were like God’s cedars.

title: Psalms 80:11
content: 11 It sent out its branches to the sea, its shoots to the River.

title: Psalms 80:12
content: 12 Why have you broken down its walls, so that all those who pass by the way pluck it?

title: Psalms 80:13
content: 13 The boar out of the wood ravages it. The wild animals of the field feed on it.

title: Psalms 80:14
content: 14 Turn again, we beg you, God of Armies. Look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vine,

title: Psalms 80:15
content: 15 the stock which your right hand planted, the branch that you made strong for yourself.

title: Psalms 80:16
content: 16 It’s burned with fire. It’s cut down. They perish at your rebuke.

title: Psalms 80:17
content: 17 Let your hand be on the man of your right hand, on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.

title: Psalms 80:18
content: 18 So we will not turn away from you. Revive us, and we will call on your name.

title: Psalms 80:19
content: 19 Turn us again, LORD God of Armies. Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.

title: Psalms 81:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. On an instrument of Gath. By Asaph. Sing aloud to God, our strength! Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob!

title: Psalms 81:2
content: 2 Raise a song, and bring here the tambourine, the pleasant lyre with the harp.

title: Psalms 81:3
content: 3 Blow the trumpet at the New Moon, at the full moon, on our feast day.

title: Psalms 81:4
content: 4 For it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

title: Psalms 81:5
content: 5 He appointed it in Joseph for a covenant, when he went out over the land of Egypt, I heard a language that I didn’t know.

title: Psalms 81:6
content: 6 “I removed his shoulder from the burden. His hands were freed from the basket.

title: Psalms 81:7
content: 7 You called in trouble, and I delivered you. I answered you in the secret place of thunder. I tested you at the waters of Meribah.” Selah.

title: Psalms 81:8
content: 8 “Hear, my people, and I will testify to you, Israel, if you would listen to me!

title: Psalms 81:9
content: 9 There shall be no strange god in you, neither shall you worship any foreign god.

title: Psalms 81:10
content: 10 I am the LORD, your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.

title: Psalms 81:11
content: 11 But my people didn’t listen to my voice. Israel desired none of me.

title: Psalms 81:12
content: 12 So I let them go after the stubbornness of their hearts, that they might walk in their own counsels.

title: Psalms 81:13
content: 13 Oh that my people would listen to me, that Israel would walk in my ways!

title: Psalms 81:14
content: 14 I would soon subdue their enemies, and turn my hand against their adversaries.

title: Psalms 81:15
content: 15 The haters of the LORD would cringe before him, and their punishment would last forever.

title: Psalms 81:16
content: 16 But he would have also fed them with the finest of the wheat. I will satisfy you with honey out of the rock.”

title: Psalms 82:1
content: 1 A Psalm by Asaph. God presides in the great assembly. He judges among the gods.

title: Psalms 82:2
content: 2 “How long will you judge unjustly, and show partiality to the wicked?” Selah.

title: Psalms 82:3
content: 3 “Defend the weak, the poor, and the fatherless. Maintain the rights of the poor and oppressed.

title: Psalms 82:4
content: 4 Rescue the weak and needy. Deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.”

title: Psalms 82:5
content: 5 They don’t know, neither do they understand. They walk back and forth in darkness. All the foundations of the earth are shaken.

title: Psalms 82:6
content: 6 I said, “You are gods, all of you are sons of the Most High.

title: Psalms 82:7
content: 7 Nevertheless you shall die like men, and fall like one of the rulers.”

title: Psalms 82:8
content: 8 Arise, God, judge the earth, for you inherit all of the nations.

title: Psalms 83:1
content: 1 A song. A Psalm by Asaph. God, don’t keep silent. Don’t keep silent, and don’t be still, God.

title: Psalms 83:2
content: 2 For, behold, your enemies are stirred up. Those who hate you have lifted up their heads.

title: Psalms 83:3
content: 3 They conspire with cunning against your people. They plot against your cherished ones.

title: Psalms 83:4
content: 4 “Come,” they say, “let’s destroy them as a nation, that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”

title: Psalms 83:5
content: 5 For they have conspired together with one mind. They form an alliance against you.

title: Psalms 83:6
content: 6 The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab, and the Hagrites;

title: Psalms 83:7
content: 7 Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;

title: Psalms 83:8
content: 8 Assyria also is joined with them. They have helped the children of Lot. Selah.

title: Psalms 83:9
content: 9 Do to them as you did to Midian, as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon;

title: Psalms 83:10
content: 10 who perished at Endor, who became as dung for the earth.

title: Psalms 83:11
content: 11 Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, yes, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

title: Psalms 83:12
content: 12 who said, “Let’s take possession of God’s pasture lands.”

title: Psalms 83:13
content: 13 My God, make them like tumbleweed, like chaff before the wind.

title: Psalms 83:14
content: 14 As the fire that burns the forest, as the flame that sets the mountains on fire,

title: Psalms 83:15
content: 15 so pursue them with your tempest, and terrify them with your storm.

title: Psalms 83:16
content: 16 Fill their faces with confusion, that they may seek your name, LORD.

title: Psalms 83:17
content: 17 Let them be disappointed and dismayed forever. Yes, let them be confounded and perish;

title: Psalms 83:18
content: 18 that they may know that you alone, whose name is the LORD, are the Most High over all the earth.

title: Psalms 84:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. On an instrument of Gath. A Psalm by the sons of Korah. How lovely are your dwellings, LORD of Armies!

title: Psalms 84:2
content: 2 My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of the LORD. My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.

title: Psalms 84:3
content: 3 Yes, the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may have her young, near your altars, LORD of Armies, my King, and my God.

title: Psalms 84:4
content: 4 Blessed are those who dwell in your house. They are always praising you. Selah.

title: Psalms 84:5
content: 5 Blessed are those whose strength is in you, who have set their hearts on a pilgrimage.

title: Psalms 84:6
content: 6 Passing through the valley of Weeping, they make it a place of springs. Yes, the autumn rain covers it with blessings.

title: Psalms 84:7
content: 7 They go from strength to strength. Every one of them appears before God in Zion.

title: Psalms 84:8
content: 8 LORD, God of Armies, hear my prayer. Listen, God of Jacob. Selah.

title: Psalms 84:9
content: 9 Behold, God our shield, look at the face of your anointed.

title: Psalms 84:10
content: 10 For a day in your courts is better than a thousand. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

title: Psalms 84:11
content: 11 For the LORD God is a sun and a shield. The LORD will give grace and glory. He withholds no good thing from those who walk blamelessly.

title: Psalms 84:12
content: 12 LORD of Armies, blessed is the man who trusts in you.

title: Psalms 85:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by the sons of Korah. LORD, you have been favorable to your land. You have restored the fortunes of Jacob.

title: Psalms 85:2
content: 2 You have forgiven the iniquity of your people. You have covered all their sin. Selah.

title: Psalms 85:3
content: 3 You have taken away all your wrath. You have turned from the fierceness of your anger.

title: Psalms 85:4
content: 4 Turn us, God of our salvation, and cause your indignation toward us to cease.

title: Psalms 85:5
content: 5 Will you be angry with us forever? Will you draw out your anger to all generations?

title: Psalms 85:6
content: 6 Won’t you revive us again, that your people may rejoice in you?

title: Psalms 85:7
content: 7 Show us your loving kindness, LORD. Grant us your salvation.

title: Psalms 85:8
content: 8 I will hear what God, the LORD, will speak, for he will speak peace to his people, his saints; but let them not turn again to folly.

title: Psalms 85:9
content: 9 Surely his salvation is near those who fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.

title: Psalms 85:10
content: 10 Mercy and truth meet together. Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

title: Psalms 85:11
content: 11 Truth springs out of the earth. Righteousness has looked down from heaven.

title: Psalms 85:12
content: 12 Yes, the LORD will give that which is good. Our land will yield its increase.

title: Psalms 85:13
content: 13 Righteousness goes before him, and prepares the way for his steps.

title: Psalms 86:1
content: 1 A Prayer by David. Hear, LORD, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.

title: Psalms 86:2
content: 2 Preserve my soul, for I am godly. You, my God, save your servant who trusts in you.

title: Psalms 86:3
content: 3 Be merciful to me, Lord, for I call to you all day long.

title: Psalms 86:4
content: 4 Bring joy to the soul of your servant, for to you, Lord, do I lift up my soul.

title: Psalms 86:5
content: 5 For you, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive, abundant in loving kindness to all those who call on you.

title: Psalms 86:6
content: 6 Hear, LORD, my prayer. Listen to the voice of my petitions.

title: Psalms 86:7
content: 7 In the day of my trouble I will call on you, for you will answer me.

title: Psalms 86:8
content: 8 There is no one like you among the gods, Lord, nor any deeds like your deeds.

title: Psalms 86:9
content: 9 All nations you have made will come and worship before you, Lord. They shall glorify your name.

title: Psalms 86:10
content: 10 For you are great, and do wondrous things. You are God alone.

title: Psalms 86:11
content: 11 Teach me your way, LORD. I will walk in your truth. Make my heart undivided to fear your name.

title: Psalms 86:12
content: 12 I will praise you, Lord my God, with my whole heart. I will glorify your name forever more.

title: Psalms 86:13
content: 13 For your loving kindness is great toward me. You have delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.

title: Psalms 86:14
content: 14 God, the proud have risen up against me. A company of violent men have sought after my soul, and they don’t hold regard for you before them.

title: Psalms 86:15
content: 15 But you, Lord, are a merciful and gracious God, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness and truth.

title: Psalms 86:16
content: 16 Turn to me, and have mercy on me! Give your strength to your servant. Save the son of your servant.

title: Psalms 86:17
content: 17 Show me a sign of your goodness, that those who hate me may see it, and be shamed, because you, LORD, have helped me, and comforted me.

title: Psalms 87:1
content: 1 A Psalm by the sons of Korah; a Song. His foundation is in the holy mountains.

title: Psalms 87:2
content: 2 The LORD loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

title: Psalms 87:3
content: 3 Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. Selah.

title: Psalms 87:4
content: 4 I will record Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me. Behold, Philistia, Tyre, and also Ethiopia: “This one was born there.”

title: Psalms 87:5
content: 5 Yes, of Zion it will be said, “This one and that one was born in her;” the Most High himself will establish her.

title: Psalms 87:6
content: 6 The LORD will count, when he writes up the peoples, “This one was born there.” Selah.

title: Psalms 87:7
content: 7 Those who sing as well as those who dance say, “All my springs are in you.”

title: Psalms 88:1
content: 1 A Song. A Psalm by the sons of Korah. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of “The Suffering of Affliction.” A contemplation by Heman, the Ezrahite. LORD, the God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before you.

title: Psalms 88:2
content: 2 Let my prayer enter into your presence. Turn your ear to my cry.

title: Psalms 88:3
content: 3 For my soul is full of troubles. My life draws near to Sheol.

title: Psalms 88:4
content: 4 I am counted among those who go down into the pit. I am like a man who has no help,

title: Psalms 88:5
content: 5 set apart among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave, whom you remember no more. They are cut off from your hand.

title: Psalms 88:6
content: 6 You have laid me in the lowest pit, in the darkest depths.

title: Psalms 88:7
content: 7 Your wrath lies heavily on me. You have afflicted me with all your waves. Selah.

title: Psalms 88:8
content: 8 You have taken my friends from me. You have made me an abomination to them. I am confined, and I can’t escape.

title: Psalms 88:9
content: 9 My eyes are dim from grief. I have called on you daily, LORD. I have spread out my hands to you.

title: Psalms 88:10
content: 10 Do you show wonders to the dead? Do the departed spirits rise up and praise you? Selah.

title: Psalms 88:11
content: 11 Is your loving kindness declared in the grave? Or your faithfulness in Destruction?

title: Psalms 88:12
content: 12 Are your wonders made known in the dark? Or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

title: Psalms 88:13
content: 13 But to you, LORD, I have cried. In the morning, my prayer comes before you.

title: Psalms 88:14
content: 14 LORD, why do you reject my soul? Why do you hide your face from me?

title: Psalms 88:15
content: 15 I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up. While I suffer your terrors, I am distracted.

title: Psalms 88:16
content: 16 Your fierce wrath has gone over me. Your terrors have cut me off.

title: Psalms 88:17
content: 17 They came around me like water all day long. They completely engulfed me.

title: Psalms 88:18
content: 18 You have put lover and friend far from me, and my friends into darkness.

title: Psalms 89:1
content: 1 A contemplation by Ethan, the Ezrahite. I will sing of the loving kindness of the LORD forever. With my mouth, I will make known your faithfulness to all generations.

title: Psalms 89:2
content: 2 I indeed declare, “Love stands firm forever. You established the heavens. Your faithfulness is in them.”

title: Psalms 89:3
content: 3 “I have made a covenant with my chosen one, I have sworn to David, my servant,

title: Psalms 89:4
content: 4 ‘I will establish your offspring forever, and build up your throne to all generations.’” Selah.

title: Psalms 89:5
content: 5 The heavens will praise your wonders, LORD, your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.

title: Psalms 89:6
content: 6 For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? Who among the sons of the heavenly beings is like the LORD,

title: Psalms 89:7
content: 7 a very awesome God in the council of the holy ones, to be feared above all those who are around him?

title: Psalms 89:8
content: 8 LORD, God of Armies, who is a mighty one, like you? LORD, your faithfulness is around you.

title: Psalms 89:9
content: 9 You rule the pride of the sea. When its waves rise up, you calm them.

title: Psalms 89:10
content: 10 You have broken Rahab in pieces, like one of the slain. You have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

title: Psalms 89:11
content: 11 The heavens are yours. The earth also is yours, the world and its fullness. You have founded them.

title: Psalms 89:12
content: 12 You have created the north and the south. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.

title: Psalms 89:13
content: 13 You have a mighty arm. Your hand is strong, and your right hand is exalted.

title: Psalms 89:14
content: 14 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. Loving kindness and truth go before your face.

title: Psalms 89:15
content: 15 Blessed are the people who learn to acclaim you. They walk in the light of your presence, LORD.

title: Psalms 89:16
content: 16 In your name they rejoice all day. In your righteousness, they are exalted.

title: Psalms 89:17
content: 17 For you are the glory of their strength. In your favor, our horn will be exalted.

title: Psalms 89:18
content: 18 For our shield belongs to the LORD, our king to the Holy One of Israel.

title: Psalms 89:19
content: 19 Then you spoke in vision to your saints, and said, “I have given strength to the warrior. I have exalted a young man from the people.

title: Psalms 89:20
content: 20 I have found David, my servant. I have anointed him with my holy oil,

title: Psalms 89:21
content: 21 with whom my hand shall be established. My arm will also strengthen him.

title: Psalms 89:22
content: 22 No enemy will tax him. No wicked man will oppress him.

title: Psalms 89:23
content: 23 I will beat down his adversaries before him, and strike those who hate him.

title: Psalms 89:24
content: 24 But my faithfulness and my loving kindness will be with him. In my name, his horn will be exalted.

title: Psalms 89:25
content: 25 I will set his hand also on the sea, and his right hand on the rivers.

title: Psalms 89:26
content: 26 He will call to me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation!’

title: Psalms 89:27
content: 27 I will also appoint him my firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.

title: Psalms 89:28
content: 28 I will keep my loving kindness for him forever more. My covenant will stand firm with him.

title: Psalms 89:29
content: 29 I will also make his offspring endure forever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

title: Psalms 89:30
content: 30 If his children forsake my law, and don’t walk in my ordinances;

title: Psalms 89:31
content: 31 if they break my statutes, and don’t keep my commandments;

title: Psalms 89:32
content: 32 then I will punish their sin with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

title: Psalms 89:33
content: 33 But I will not completely take my loving kindness from him, nor allow my faithfulness to fail.

title: Psalms 89:34
content: 34 I will not break my covenant, nor alter what my lips have uttered.

title: Psalms 89:35
content: 35 Once I have sworn by my holiness, I will not lie to David.

title: Psalms 89:36
content: 36 His offspring will endure forever, his throne like the sun before me.

title: Psalms 89:37
content: 37 It will be established forever like the moon, the faithful witness in the sky.” Selah.

title: Psalms 89:38
content: 38 But you have rejected and spurned. You have been angry with your anointed.

title: Psalms 89:39
content: 39 You have renounced the covenant of your servant. You have defiled his crown in the dust.

title: Psalms 89:40
content: 40 You have broken down all his hedges. You have brought his strongholds to ruin.

title: Psalms 89:41
content: 41 All who pass by the way rob him. He has become a reproach to his neighbors.

title: Psalms 89:42
content: 42 You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries. You have made all of his enemies rejoice.

title: Psalms 89:43
content: 43 Yes, you turn back the edge of his sword, and haven’t supported him in battle.

title: Psalms 89:44
content: 44 You have ended his splendor, and thrown his throne down to the ground.

title: Psalms 89:45
content: 45 You have shortened the days of his youth. You have covered him with shame. Selah.

title: Psalms 89:46
content: 46 How long, LORD? Will you hide yourself forever? Will your wrath burn like fire?

title: Psalms 89:47
content: 47 Remember how short my time is, for what vanity you have created all the children of men!

title: Psalms 89:48
content: 48 What man is he who shall live and not see death, who shall deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.

title: Psalms 89:49
content: 49 Lord, where are your former loving kindnesses, which you swore to David in your faithfulness?

title: Psalms 89:50
content: 50 Remember, Lord, the reproach of your servants, how I bear in my heart the taunts of all the mighty peoples,

title: Psalms 89:51
content: 51 With which your enemies have mocked, LORD, with which they have mocked the footsteps of your anointed one.

title: Psalms 89:52
content: 52 Blessed be the LORD forever more. Amen, and Amen.

title: Psalms 90:1
content: 1 A Prayer by Moses, the man of God. Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.

title: Psalms 90:2
content: 2 Before the mountains were born, before you had formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.

title: Psalms 90:3
content: 3 You turn man to destruction, saying, “Return, you children of men.”

title: Psalms 90:4
content: 4 For a thousand years in your sight are just like yesterday when it is past, like a watch in the night.

title: Psalms 90:5
content: 5 You sweep them away as they sleep. In the morning they sprout like new grass.

title: Psalms 90:6
content: 6 In the morning it sprouts and springs up. By evening, it is withered and dry.

title: Psalms 90:7
content: 7 For we are consumed in your anger. We are troubled in your wrath.

title: Psalms 90:8
content: 8 You have set our iniquities before you, our secret sins in the light of your presence.

title: Psalms 90:9
content: 9 For all our days have passed away in your wrath. We bring our years to an end as a sigh.

title: Psalms 90:10
content: 10 The days of our years are seventy, or even by reason of strength eighty years; yet their pride is but labor and sorrow, for it passes quickly, and we fly away.

title: Psalms 90:11
content: 11 Who knows the power of your anger, your wrath according to the fear that is due to you?

title: Psalms 90:12
content: 12 So teach us to count our days, that we may gain a heart of wisdom.

title: Psalms 90:13
content: 13 Relent, LORD! How long? Have compassion on your servants!

title: Psalms 90:14
content: 14 Satisfy us in the morning with your loving kindness, that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

title: Psalms 90:15
content: 15 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen evil.

title: Psalms 90:16
content: 16 Let your work appear to your servants, your glory to their children.

title: Psalms 90:17
content: 17 Let the favor of the Lord our God be on us. Establish the work of our hands for us. Yes, establish the work of our hands.

title: Psalms 91:1
content: 1 He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

title: Psalms 91:2
content: 2 I will say of the LORD, “He is my refuge and my fortress; my God, in whom I trust.”

title: Psalms 91:3
content: 3 For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, and from the deadly pestilence.

title: Psalms 91:4
content: 4 He will cover you with his feathers. Under his wings you will take refuge. His faithfulness is your shield and rampart.

title: Psalms 91:5
content: 5 You shall not be afraid of the terror by night, nor of the arrow that flies by day,

title: Psalms 91:6
content: 6 nor of the pestilence that walks in darkness, nor of the destruction that wastes at noonday.

title: Psalms 91:7
content: 7 A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand; but it will not come near you.

title: Psalms 91:8
content: 8 You will only look with your eyes, and see the recompense of the wicked.

title: Psalms 91:9
content: 9 Because you have made the LORD your refuge, and the Most High your dwelling place,

title: Psalms 91:10
content: 10 no evil shall happen to you, neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.

title: Psalms 91:11
content: 11 For he will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you in all your ways.

title: Psalms 91:12
content: 12 They will bear you up in their hands, so that you won’t dash your foot against a stone.

title: Psalms 91:13
content: 13 You will tread on the lion and cobra. You will trample the young lion and the serpent underfoot.

title: Psalms 91:14
content: 14 “Because he has set his love on me, therefore I will deliver him. I will set him on high, because he has known my name.

title: Psalms 91:15
content: 15 He will call on me, and I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble. I will deliver him, and honor him.

title: Psalms 91:16
content: 16 I will satisfy him with long life, and show him my salvation.”

title: Psalms 92:1
content: 1 A Psalm. A song for the Sabbath day. It is a good thing to give thanks to the LORD, to sing praises to your name, Most High,

title: Psalms 92:2
content: 2 to proclaim your loving kindness in the morning, and your faithfulness every night,

title: Psalms 92:3
content: 3 with the ten-stringed lute, with the harp, and with the melody of the lyre.

title: Psalms 92:4
content: 4 For you, LORD, have made me glad through your work. I will triumph in the works of your hands.

title: Psalms 92:5
content: 5 How great are your works, LORD! Your thoughts are very deep.

title: Psalms 92:6
content: 6 A senseless man doesn’t know, neither does a fool understand this:

title: Psalms 92:7
content: 7 though the wicked spring up as the grass, and all the evildoers flourish, they will be destroyed forever.

title: Psalms 92:8
content: 8 But you, LORD, are on high forever more.

title: Psalms 92:9
content: 9 For behold, your enemies, LORD, for behold, your enemies shall perish. All the evildoers will be scattered.

title: Psalms 92:10
content: 10 But you have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox. I am anointed with fresh oil.

title: Psalms 92:11
content: 11 My eye has also seen my enemies. My ears have heard of the wicked enemies who rise up against me.

title: Psalms 92:12
content: 12 The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree. He will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

title: Psalms 92:13
content: 13 They are planted in the LORD’s house. They will flourish in our God’s courts.

title: Psalms 92:14
content: 14 They will still produce fruit in old age. They will be full of sap and green,

title: Psalms 92:15
content: 15 to show that the LORD is upright. He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

title: Psalms 93:1
content: 1 The LORD reigns! He is clothed with majesty! The LORD is armed with strength. The world also is established. It can’t be moved.

title: Psalms 93:2
content: 2 Your throne is established from long ago. You are from everlasting.

title: Psalms 93:3
content: 3 The floods have lifted up, LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice. The floods lift up their waves.

title: Psalms 93:4
content: 4 Above the voices of many waters, the mighty breakers of the sea, the LORD on high is mighty.

title: Psalms 93:5
content: 5 Your statutes stand firm. Holiness adorns your house, LORD, forever more.

title: Psalms 94:1
content: 1 LORD, you God to whom vengeance belongs, you God to whom vengeance belongs, shine out.

title: Psalms 94:2
content: 2 Rise up, you judge of the earth. Pay back the proud what they deserve.

title: Psalms 94:3
content: 3 LORD, how long will the wicked, how long will the wicked triumph?

title: Psalms 94:4
content: 4 They pour out arrogant words. All the evildoers boast.

title: Psalms 94:5
content: 5 They break your people in pieces, LORD, and afflict your heritage.

title: Psalms 94:6
content: 6 They kill the widow and the alien, and murder the fatherless.

title: Psalms 94:7
content: 7 They say, “The LORD will not see, neither will Jacob’s God consider.”

title: Psalms 94:8
content: 8 Consider, you senseless among the people; you fools, when will you be wise?

title: Psalms 94:9
content: 9 He who implanted the ear, won’t he hear? He who formed the eye, won’t he see?

title: Psalms 94:10
content: 10 He who disciplines the nations, won’t he punish? He who teaches man knows.

title: Psalms 94:11
content: 11 The LORD knows the thoughts of man, that they are futile.

title: Psalms 94:12
content: 12 Blessed is the man whom you discipline, LORD, and teach out of your law,

title: Psalms 94:13
content: 13 that you may give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit is dug for the wicked.

title: Psalms 94:14
content: 14 For the LORD won’t reject his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

title: Psalms 94:15
content: 15 For judgment will return to righteousness. All the upright in heart shall follow it.

title: Psalms 94:16
content: 16 Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will stand up for me against the evildoers?

title: Psalms 94:17
content: 17 Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul would have soon lived in silence.

title: Psalms 94:18
content: 18 When I said, “My foot is slipping!” Your loving kindness, LORD, held me up.

title: Psalms 94:19
content: 19 In the multitude of my thoughts within me, your comforts delight my soul.

title: Psalms 94:20
content: 20 Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with you, which brings about mischief by statute?

title: Psalms 94:21
content: 21 They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

title: Psalms 94:22
content: 22 But the LORD has been my high tower, my God, the rock of my refuge.

title: Psalms 94:23
content: 23 He has brought on them their own iniquity, and will cut them off in their own wickedness. The LORD, our God, will cut them off.

title: Psalms 95:1
content: 1 Oh come, let’s sing to the LORD. Let’s shout aloud to the rock of our salvation!

title: Psalms 95:2
content: 2 Let’s come before his presence with thanksgiving. Let’s extol him with songs!

title: Psalms 95:3
content: 3 For the LORD is a great God, a great King above all gods.

title: Psalms 95:4
content: 4 In his hand are the deep places of the earth. The heights of the mountains are also his.

title: Psalms 95:5
content: 5 The sea is his, and he made it. His hands formed the dry land.

title: Psalms 95:6
content: 6 Oh come, let’s worship and bow down. Let’s kneel before the LORD, our Maker,

title: Psalms 95:7
content: 7 for he is our God. We are the people of his pasture, and the sheep in his care. Today, oh that you would hear his voice!

title: Psalms 95:8
content: 8 Don’t harden your heart, as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

title: Psalms 95:9
content: 9 when your fathers tempted me, tested me, and saw my work.

title: Psalms 95:10
content: 10 Forty long years I was grieved with that generation, and said, “They are a people who err in their heart. They have not known my ways.”

title: Psalms 95:11
content: 11 Therefore I swore in my wrath, “They won’t enter into my rest.”

title: Psalms 96:1
content: 1 Sing to the LORD a new song! Sing to the LORD, all the earth.

title: Psalms 96:2
content: 2 Sing to the LORD! Bless his name! Proclaim his salvation from day to day!

title: Psalms 96:3
content: 3 Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all the peoples.

title: Psalms 96:4
content: 4 For the LORD is great, and greatly to be praised! He is to be feared above all gods.

title: Psalms 96:5
content: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

title: Psalms 96:6
content: 6 Honor and majesty are before him. Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

title: Psalms 96:7
content: 7 Ascribe to the LORD, you families of nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

title: Psalms 96:8
content: 8 Ascribe to the LORD the glory due to his name. Bring an offering, and come into his courts.

title: Psalms 96:9
content: 9 Worship the LORD in holy array. Tremble before him, all the earth.

title: Psalms 96:10
content: 10 Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns.” The world is also established. It can’t be moved. He will judge the peoples with equity.

title: Psalms 96:11
content: 11 Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice. Let the sea roar, and its fullness!

title: Psalms 96:12
content: 12 Let the field and all that is in it exult! Then all the trees of the woods shall sing for joy

title: Psalms 96:13
content: 13 before the LORD; for he comes, for he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, the peoples with his truth.

title: Psalms 97:1
content: 1 The LORD reigns! Let the earth rejoice! Let the multitude of islands be glad!

title: Psalms 97:2
content: 2 Clouds and darkness are around him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

title: Psalms 97:3
content: 3 A fire goes before him, and burns up his adversaries on every side.

title: Psalms 97:4
content: 4 His lightning lights up the world. The earth sees, and trembles.

title: Psalms 97:5
content: 5 The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

title: Psalms 97:6
content: 6 The heavens declare his righteousness. All the peoples have seen his glory.

title: Psalms 97:7
content: 7 Let all them be shamed who serve engraved images, who boast in their idols. Worship him, all you gods!

title: Psalms 97:8
content: 8 Zion heard and was glad. The daughters of Judah rejoiced because of your judgments, LORD.

title: Psalms 97:9
content: 9 For you, LORD, are most high above all the earth. You are exalted far above all gods.

title: Psalms 97:10
content: 10 You who love the LORD, hate evil! He preserves the souls of his saints. He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.

title: Psalms 97:11
content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

title: Psalms 97:12
content: 12 Be glad in the LORD, you righteous people! Give thanks to his holy Name.

title: Psalms 98:1
content: 1 A Psalm. Sing to the LORD a new song, for he has done marvelous things! His right hand and his holy arm have worked salvation for him.

title: Psalms 98:2
content: 2 The LORD has made known his salvation. He has openly shown his righteousness in the sight of the nations.

title: Psalms 98:3
content: 3 He has remembered his loving kindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

title: Psalms 98:4
content: 4 Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth! Burst out and sing for joy, yes, sing praises!

title: Psalms 98:5
content: 5 Sing praises to the LORD with the harp, with the harp and the voice of melody.

title: Psalms 98:6
content: 6 With trumpets and sound of the ram’s horn, make a joyful noise before the King, the LORD.

title: Psalms 98:7
content: 7 Let the sea roar with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

title: Psalms 98:8
content: 8 Let the rivers clap their hands. Let the mountains sing for joy together.

title: Psalms 98:9
content: 9 Let them sing before the LORD, for he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, and the peoples with equity.

title: Psalms 99:1
content: 1 The LORD reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned among the cherubim. Let the earth be moved.

title: Psalms 99:2
content: 2 The LORD is great in Zion. He is high above all the peoples.

title: Psalms 99:3
content: 3 Let them praise your great and awesome name. He is Holy!

title: Psalms 99:4
content: 4 The King’s strength also loves justice. You establish equity. You execute justice and righteousness in Jacob.

title: Psalms 99:5
content: 5 Exalt the LORD our God. Worship at his footstool. He is Holy!

title: Psalms 99:6
content: 6 Moses and Aaron were among his priests, Samuel was among those who call on his name. They called on the LORD, and he answered them.

title: Psalms 99:7
content: 7 He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud. They kept his testimonies, the statute that he gave them.

title: Psalms 99:8
content: 8 You answered them, LORD our God. You are a God who forgave them, although you took vengeance for their doings.

title: Psalms 99:9
content: 9 Exalt the LORD, our God. Worship at his holy hill, for the LORD, our God, is holy!

title: Psalms 100:1
content: 1 A Psalm of thanksgiving. Shout for joy to the LORD, all you lands!

title: Psalms 100:2
content: 2 Serve the LORD with gladness. Come before his presence with singing.

title: Psalms 100:3
content: 3 Know that the LORD, he is God. It is he who has made us, and we are his. We are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

title: Psalms 100:4
content: 4 Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise. Give thanks to him, and bless his name.

title: Psalms 100:5
content: 5 For the LORD is good. His loving kindness endures forever, his faithfulness to all generations.

title: Psalms 101:1
content: 1 A Psalm by David. I will sing of loving kindness and justice. To you, LORD, I will sing praises.

title: Psalms 101:2
content: 2 I will be careful to live a blameless life. When will you come to me? I will walk within my house with a blameless heart.

title: Psalms 101:3
content: 3 I will set no vile thing before my eyes. I hate the deeds of faithless men. They will not cling to me.

title: Psalms 101:4
content: 4 A perverse heart will be far from me. I will have nothing to do with evil.

title: Psalms 101:5
content: 5 I will silence whoever secretly slanders his neighbor. I won’t tolerate one who is arrogant and conceited.

title: Psalms 101:6
content: 6 My eyes will be on the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me. He who walks in a perfect way, he will serve me.

title: Psalms 101:7
content: 7 He who practices deceit won’t dwell within my house. He who speaks falsehood won’t be established before my eyes.

title: Psalms 101:8
content: 8 Morning by morning, I will destroy all the wicked of the land, to cut off all the workers of iniquity from the LORD’s city.

title: Psalms 102:1
content: 1 A Prayer of the afflicted, when he is overwhelmed and pours out his complaint before the LORD. Hear my prayer, LORD! Let my cry come to you.

title: Psalms 102:2
content: 2 Don’t hide your face from me in the day of my distress. Turn your ear to me. Answer me quickly in the day when I call.

title: Psalms 102:3
content: 3 For my days consume away like smoke. My bones are burned as a torch.

title: Psalms 102:4
content: 4 My heart is blighted like grass, and withered, for I forget to eat my bread.

title: Psalms 102:5
content: 5 By reason of the voice of my groaning, my bones stick to my skin.

title: Psalms 102:6
content: 6 I am like a pelican of the wilderness. I have become as an owl of the waste places.

title: Psalms 102:7
content: 7 I watch, and have become like a sparrow that is alone on the housetop.

title: Psalms 102:8
content: 8 My enemies reproach me all day. Those who are mad at me use my name as a curse.

title: Psalms 102:9
content: 9 For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mixed my drink with tears,

title: Psalms 102:10
content: 10 because of your indignation and your wrath; for you have taken me up and thrown me away.

title: Psalms 102:11
content: 11 My days are like a long shadow. I have withered like grass.

title: Psalms 102:12
content: 12 But you, LORD, will remain forever; your renown endures to all generations.

title: Psalms 102:13
content: 13 You will arise and have mercy on Zion, for it is time to have pity on her. Yes, the set time has come.

title: Psalms 102:14
content: 14 For your servants take pleasure in her stones, and have pity on her dust.

title: Psalms 102:15
content: 15 So the nations will fear the LORD’s name, all the kings of the earth your glory.

title: Psalms 102:16
content: 16 For the LORD has built up Zion. He has appeared in his glory.

title: Psalms 102:17
content: 17 He has responded to the prayer of the destitute, and has not despised their prayer.

title: Psalms 102:18
content: 18 This will be written for the generation to come. A people which will be created will praise the LORD,

title: Psalms 102:19
content: 19 for he has looked down from the height of his sanctuary. From heaven, the LORD saw the earth,

title: Psalms 102:20
content: 20 to hear the groans of the prisoner, to free those who are condemned to death,

title: Psalms 102:21
content: 21 that men may declare the LORD’s name in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem,

title: Psalms 102:22
content: 22 when the peoples are gathered together, the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

title: Psalms 102:23
content: 23 He weakened my strength along the course. He shortened my days.

title: Psalms 102:24
content: 24 I said, “My God, don’t take me away in the middle of my days. Your years are throughout all generations.

title: Psalms 102:25
content: 25 Of old, you laid the foundation of the earth. The heavens are the work of your hands.

title: Psalms 102:26
content: 26 They will perish, but you will endure. Yes, all of them will wear out like a garment. You will change them like a cloak, and they will be changed.

title: Psalms 102:27
content: 27 But you are the same. Your years will have no end.

title: Psalms 102:28
content: 28 The children of your servants will continue. Their offspring will be established before you.”

title: Psalms 103:1
content: 1 By David. Praise the LORD, my soul! All that is within me, praise his holy name!

title: Psalms 103:2
content: 2 Praise the LORD, my soul, and don’t forget all his benefits,

title: Psalms 103:3
content: 3 who forgives all your sins, who heals all your diseases,

title: Psalms 103:4
content: 4 who redeems your life from destruction, who crowns you with loving kindness and tender mercies,

title: Psalms 103:5
content: 5 who satisfies your desire with good things, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

title: Psalms 103:6
content: 6 The LORD executes righteous acts, and justice for all who are oppressed.

title: Psalms 103:7
content: 7 He made known his ways to Moses, his deeds to the children of Israel.

title: Psalms 103:8
content: 8 The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness.

title: Psalms 103:9
content: 9 He will not always accuse; neither will he stay angry forever.

title: Psalms 103:10
content: 10 He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor repaid us for our iniquities.

title: Psalms 103:11
content: 11 For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is his loving kindness toward those who fear him.

title: Psalms 103:12
content: 12 As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.

title: Psalms 103:13
content: 13 Like a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear him.

title: Psalms 103:14
content: 14 For he knows how we are made. He remembers that we are dust.

title: Psalms 103:15
content: 15 As for man, his days are like grass. As a flower of the field, so he flourishes.

title: Psalms 103:16
content: 16 For the wind passes over it, and it is gone. Its place remembers it no more.

title: Psalms 103:17
content: 17 But the LORD’s loving kindness is from everlasting to everlasting with those who fear him, his righteousness to children’s children,

title: Psalms 103:18
content: 18 to those who keep his covenant, to those who remember to obey his precepts.

title: Psalms 103:19
content: 19 The LORD has established his throne in the heavens. His kingdom rules over all.

title: Psalms 103:20
content: 20 Praise the LORD, you angels of his, who are mighty in strength, who fulfill his word, obeying the voice of his word.

title: Psalms 103:21
content: 21 Praise the LORD, all you armies of his, you servants of his, who do his pleasure.

title: Psalms 103:22
content: 22 Praise the LORD, all you works of his, in all places of his dominion. Praise the LORD, my soul!

title: Psalms 104:1
content: 1 Bless the LORD, my soul. The LORD, my God, you are very great. You are clothed with honor and majesty.

title: Psalms 104:2
content: 2 He covers himself with light as with a garment. He stretches out the heavens like a curtain.

title: Psalms 104:3
content: 3 He lays the beams of his rooms in the waters. He makes the clouds his chariot. He walks on the wings of the wind.

title: Psalms 104:4
content: 4 He makes his messengers winds, and his servants flames of fire.

title: Psalms 104:5
content: 5 He laid the foundations of the earth, that it should not be moved forever.

title: Psalms 104:6
content: 6 You covered it with the deep as with a cloak. The waters stood above the mountains.

title: Psalms 104:7
content: 7 At your rebuke they fled. At the voice of your thunder they hurried away.

title: Psalms 104:8
content: 8 The mountains rose, the valleys sank down, to the place which you had assigned to them.

title: Psalms 104:9
content: 9 You have set a boundary that they may not pass over, that they don’t turn again to cover the earth.

title: Psalms 104:10
content: 10 He sends springs into the valleys. They run among the mountains.

title: Psalms 104:11
content: 11 They give drink to every animal of the field. The wild donkeys quench their thirst.

title: Psalms 104:12
content: 12 The birds of the sky nest by them. They sing among the branches.

title: Psalms 104:13
content: 13 He waters the mountains from his rooms. The earth is filled with the fruit of your works.

title: Psalms 104:14
content: 14 He causes the grass to grow for the livestock, and plants for man to cultivate, that he may produce food out of the earth:

title: Psalms 104:15
content: 15 wine that makes the heart of man glad, oil to make his face to shine, and bread that strengthens man’s heart.

title: Psalms 104:16
content: 16 The LORD’s trees are well watered, the cedars of Lebanon, which he has planted,

title: Psalms 104:17
content: 17 where the birds make their nests. The stork makes its home in the cypress trees.

title: Psalms 104:18
content: 18 The high mountains are for the wild goats. The rocks are a refuge for the rock badgers.

title: Psalms 104:19
content: 19 He appointed the moon for seasons. The sun knows when to set.

title: Psalms 104:20
content: 20 You make darkness, and it is night, in which all the animals of the forest prowl.

title: Psalms 104:21
content: 21 The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their food from God.

title: Psalms 104:22
content: 22 The sun rises, and they steal away, and lie down in their dens.

title: Psalms 104:23
content: 23 Man goes out to his work, to his labor until the evening.

title: Psalms 104:24
content: 24 LORD, how many are your works! In wisdom, you have made them all. The earth is full of your riches.

title: Psalms 104:25
content: 25 There is the sea, great and wide, in which are innumerable living things, both small and large animals.

title: Psalms 104:26
content: 26 There the ships go, and leviathan, whom you formed to play there.

title: Psalms 104:27
content: 27 These all wait for you, that you may give them their food in due season.

title: Psalms 104:28
content: 28 You give to them; they gather. You open your hand; they are satisfied with good.

title: Psalms 104:29
content: 29 You hide your face; they are troubled. You take away their breath; they die and return to the dust.

title: Psalms 104:30
content: 30 You send out your Spirit and they are created. You renew the face of the ground.

title: Psalms 104:31
content: 31 Let the LORD’s glory endure forever. Let the LORD rejoice in his works.

title: Psalms 104:32
content: 32 He looks at the earth, and it trembles. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.

title: Psalms 104:33
content: 33 I will sing to the LORD as long as I live. I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.

title: Psalms 104:34
content: 34 Let my meditation be sweet to him. I will rejoice in the LORD.

title: Psalms 104:35
content: 35 Let sinners be consumed out of the earth. Let the wicked be no more. Bless the LORD, my soul. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 105:1
content: 1 Give thanks to the LORD! Call on his name! Make his doings known among the peoples.

title: Psalms 105:2
content: 2 Sing to him, sing praises to him! Tell of all his marvelous works.

title: Psalms 105:3
content: 3 Glory in his holy name. Let the heart of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

title: Psalms 105:4
content: 4 Seek the LORD and his strength. Seek his face forever more.

title: Psalms 105:5
content: 5 Remember his marvelous works that he has done: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

title: Psalms 105:6
content: 6 you offspring of Abraham, his servant, you children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

title: Psalms 105:7
content: 7 He is the LORD, our God. His judgments are in all the earth.

title: Psalms 105:8
content: 8 He has remembered his covenant forever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations,

title: Psalms 105:9
content: 9 the covenant which he made with Abraham, his oath to Isaac,

title: Psalms 105:10
content: 10 and confirmed it to Jacob for a statute; to Israel for an everlasting covenant,

title: Psalms 105:11
content: 11 saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance,”

title: Psalms 105:12
content: 12 when they were but a few men in number, yes, very few, and foreigners in it.

title: Psalms 105:13
content: 13 They went about from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people.

title: Psalms 105:14
content: 14 He allowed no one to do them wrong. Yes, he reproved kings for their sakes,

title: Psalms 105:15
content: 15 “Don’t touch my anointed ones! Do my prophets no harm!”

title: Psalms 105:16
content: 16 He called for a famine on the land. He destroyed the food supplies.

title: Psalms 105:17
content: 17 He sent a man before them. Joseph was sold for a slave.

title: Psalms 105:18
content: 18 They bruised his feet with shackles. His neck was locked in irons,

title: Psalms 105:19
content: 19 until the time that his word happened, and the LORD’s word proved him true.

title: Psalms 105:20
content: 20 The king sent and freed him, even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free.

title: Psalms 105:21
content: 21 He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all of his possessions,

title: Psalms 105:22
content: 22 to discipline his princes at his pleasure, and to teach his elders wisdom.

title: Psalms 105:23
content: 23 Israel also came into Egypt. Jacob lived in the land of Ham.

title: Psalms 105:24
content: 24 He increased his people greatly, and made them stronger than their adversaries.

title: Psalms 105:25
content: 25 He turned their heart to hate his people, to conspire against his servants.

title: Psalms 105:26
content: 26 He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.

title: Psalms 105:27
content: 27 They performed miracles among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

title: Psalms 105:28
content: 28 He sent darkness, and made it dark. They didn’t rebel against his words.

title: Psalms 105:29
content: 29 He turned their waters into blood, and killed their fish.

title: Psalms 105:30
content: 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, even in the rooms of their kings.

title: Psalms 105:31
content: 31 He spoke, and swarms of flies came, and lice in all their borders.

title: Psalms 105:32
content: 32 He gave them hail for rain, with lightning in their land.

title: Psalms 105:33
content: 33 He struck their vines and also their fig trees, and shattered the trees of their country.

title: Psalms 105:34
content: 34 He spoke, and the locusts came with the grasshoppers, without number.

title: Psalms 105:35
content: 35 They ate up every plant in their land, and ate up the fruit of their ground.

title: Psalms 105:36
content: 36 He struck also all the firstborn in their land, the first fruits of all their manhood.

title: Psalms 105:37
content: 37 He brought them out with silver and gold. There was not one feeble person among his tribes.

title: Psalms 105:38
content: 38 Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them had fallen on them.

title: Psalms 105:39
content: 39 He spread a cloud for a covering, fire to give light in the night.

title: Psalms 105:40
content: 40 They asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of the sky.

title: Psalms 105:41
content: 41 He opened the rock, and waters gushed out. They ran as a river in the dry places.

title: Psalms 105:42
content: 42 For he remembered his holy word, and Abraham, his servant.

title: Psalms 105:43
content: 43 He brought his people out with joy, his chosen with singing.

title: Psalms 105:44
content: 44 He gave them the lands of the nations. They took the labor of the peoples in possession,

title: Psalms 105:45
content: 45 that they might keep his statutes, and observe his laws. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 106:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 106:2
content: 2 Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD, or fully declare all his praise?

title: Psalms 106:3
content: 3 Blessed are those who keep justice. Blessed is one who does what is right at all times.

title: Psalms 106:4
content: 4 Remember me, LORD, with the favor that you show to your people. Visit me with your salvation,

title: Psalms 106:5
content: 5 that I may see the prosperity of your chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of your nation, that I may glory with your inheritance.

title: Psalms 106:6
content: 6 We have sinned with our fathers. We have committed iniquity. We have done wickedly.

title: Psalms 106:7
content: 7 Our fathers didn’t understand your wonders in Egypt. They didn’t remember the multitude of your loving kindnesses, but were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

title: Psalms 106:8
content: 8 Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power known.

title: Psalms 106:9
content: 9 He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up; so he led them through the depths, as through a desert.

title: Psalms 106:10
content: 10 He saved them from the hand of him who hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

title: Psalms 106:11
content: 11 The waters covered their adversaries. There was not one of them left.

title: Psalms 106:12
content: 12 Then they believed his words. They sang his praise.

title: Psalms 106:13
content: 13 They soon forgot his works. They didn’t wait for his counsel,

title: Psalms 106:14
content: 14 but gave in to craving in the desert, and tested God in the wasteland.

title: Psalms 106:15
content: 15 He gave them their request, but sent leanness into their soul.

title: Psalms 106:16
content: 16 They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron, the LORD’s saint.

title: Psalms 106:17
content: 17 The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

title: Psalms 106:18
content: 18 A fire was kindled in their company. The flame burned up the wicked.

title: Psalms 106:19
content: 19 They made a calf in Horeb, and worshiped a molten image.

title: Psalms 106:20
content: 20 Thus they exchanged their glory for an image of a bull that eats grass.

title: Psalms 106:21
content: 21 They forgot God, their Savior, who had done great things in Egypt,

title: Psalms 106:22
content: 22 wondrous works in the land of Ham, and awesome things by the Red Sea.

title: Psalms 106:23
content: 23 Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had Moses, his chosen, not stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, so that he wouldn’t destroy them.

title: Psalms 106:24
content: 24 Yes, they despised the pleasant land. They didn’t believe his word,

title: Psalms 106:25
content: 25 but murmured in their tents, and didn’t listen to the LORD’s voice.

title: Psalms 106:26
content: 26 Therefore he swore to them that he would overthrow them in the wilderness,

title: Psalms 106:27
content: 27 that he would overthrow their offspring among the nations, and scatter them in the lands.

title: Psalms 106:28
content: 28 They joined themselves also to Baal Peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

title: Psalms 106:29
content: 29 Thus they provoked him to anger with their deeds. The plague broke in on them.

title: Psalms 106:30
content: 30 Then Phinehas stood up and executed judgment, so the plague was stopped.

title: Psalms 106:31
content: 31 That was credited to him for righteousness, for all generations to come.

title: Psalms 106:32
content: 32 They angered him also at the waters of Meribah, so that Moses was troubled for their sakes;

title: Psalms 106:33
content: 33 because they were rebellious against his spirit, he spoke rashly with his lips.

title: Psalms 106:34
content: 34 They didn’t destroy the peoples, as the LORD commanded them,

title: Psalms 106:35
content: 35 but mixed themselves with the nations, and learned their works.

title: Psalms 106:36
content: 36 They served their idols, which became a snare to them.

title: Psalms 106:37
content: 37 Yes, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

title: Psalms 106:38
content: 38 They shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan. The land was polluted with blood.

title: Psalms 106:39
content: 39 Thus they were defiled with their works, and prostituted themselves in their deeds.

title: Psalms 106:40
content: 40 Therefore the LORD burned with anger against his people. He abhorred his inheritance.

title: Psalms 106:41
content: 41 He gave them into the hand of the nations. Those who hated them ruled over them.

title: Psalms 106:42
content: 42 Their enemies also oppressed them. They were brought into subjection under their hand.

title: Psalms 106:43
content: 43 He rescued them many times, but they were rebellious in their counsel, and were brought low in their iniquity.

title: Psalms 106:44
content: 44 Nevertheless he regarded their distress, when he heard their cry.

title: Psalms 106:45
content: 45 He remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses.

title: Psalms 106:46
content: 46 He made them also to be pitied by all those who carried them captive.

title: Psalms 106:47
content: 47 Save us, LORD, our God, gather us from among the nations, to give thanks to your holy name, to triumph in your praise!

title: Psalms 106:48
content: 48 Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting! Let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 107:1
content: 1 Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 107:2
content: 2 Let the redeemed by the LORD say so, whom he has redeemed from the hand of the adversary,

title: Psalms 107:3
content: 3 and gathered out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.

title: Psalms 107:4
content: 4 They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way. They found no city to live in.

title: Psalms 107:5
content: 5 Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

title: Psalms 107:6
content: 6 Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

title: Psalms 107:7
content: 7 He led them also by a straight way, that they might go to a city to live in.

title: Psalms 107:8
content: 8 Let them praise the LORD for his loving kindness, for his wonderful deeds to the children of men!

title: Psalms 107:9
content: 9 For he satisfies the longing soul. He fills the hungry soul with good.

title: Psalms 107:10
content: 10 Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron,

title: Psalms 107:11
content: 11 because they rebelled against the words of God, and condemned the counsel of the Most High.

title: Psalms 107:12
content: 12 Therefore he brought down their heart with labor. They fell down, and there was no one to help.

title: Psalms 107:13
content: 13 Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

title: Psalms 107:14
content: 14 He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke away their chains.

title: Psalms 107:15
content: 15 Let them praise the LORD for his loving kindness, for his wonderful deeds to the children of men!

title: Psalms 107:16
content: 16 For he has broken the gates of bronze, and cut through bars of iron.

title: Psalms 107:17
content: 17 Fools are afflicted because of their disobedience, and because of their iniquities.

title: Psalms 107:18
content: 18 Their soul abhors all kinds of food. They draw near to the gates of death.

title: Psalms 107:19
content: 19 Then they cry to the LORD in their trouble, and he saves them out of their distresses.

title: Psalms 107:20
content: 20 He sends his word, and heals them, and delivers them from their graves.

title: Psalms 107:21
content: 21 Let them praise the LORD for his loving kindness, for his wonderful deeds to the children of men!

title: Psalms 107:22
content: 22 Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his deeds with singing.

title: Psalms 107:23
content: 23 Those who go down to the sea in ships, who do business in great waters,

title: Psalms 107:24
content: 24 these see the LORD’s deeds, and his wonders in the deep.

title: Psalms 107:25
content: 25 For he commands, and raises the stormy wind, which lifts up its waves.

title: Psalms 107:26
content: 26 They mount up to the sky; they go down again to the depths. Their soul melts away because of trouble.

title: Psalms 107:27
content: 27 They reel back and forth, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.

title: Psalms 107:28
content: 28 Then they cry to the LORD in their trouble, and he brings them out of their distress.

title: Psalms 107:29
content: 29 He makes the storm a calm, so that its waves are still.

title: Psalms 107:30
content: 30 Then they are glad because it is calm, so he brings them to their desired haven.

title: Psalms 107:31
content: 31 Let them praise the LORD for his loving kindness, for his wonderful deeds for the children of men!

title: Psalms 107:32
content: 32 Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people, and praise him in the seat of the elders.

title: Psalms 107:33
content: 33 He turns rivers into a desert, water springs into a thirsty ground,

title: Psalms 107:34
content: 34 and a fruitful land into a salt waste, for the wickedness of those who dwell in it.

title: Psalms 107:35
content: 35 He turns a desert into a pool of water, and a dry land into water springs.

title: Psalms 107:36
content: 36 There he makes the hungry live, that they may prepare a city to live in,

title: Psalms 107:37
content: 37 sow fields, plant vineyards, and reap the fruits of increase.

title: Psalms 107:38
content: 38 He blesses them also, so that they are multiplied greatly. He doesn’t allow their livestock to decrease.

title: Psalms 107:39
content: 39 Again, they are diminished and bowed down through oppression, trouble, and sorrow.

title: Psalms 107:40
content: 40 He pours contempt on princes, and causes them to wander in a trackless waste.

title: Psalms 107:41
content: 41 Yet he lifts the needy out of their affliction, and increases their families like a flock.

title: Psalms 107:42
content: 42 The upright will see it, and be glad. All the wicked will shut their mouths.

title: Psalms 107:43
content: 43 Whoever is wise will pay attention to these things. They will consider the loving kindnesses of the LORD.

title: Psalms 108:1
content: 1 A Song. A Psalm by David. My heart is steadfast, God. I will sing and I will make music with my soul.

title: Psalms 108:2
content: 2 Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn.

title: Psalms 108:3
content: 3 I will give thanks to you, LORD, among the nations. I will sing praises to you among the peoples.

title: Psalms 108:4
content: 4 For your loving kindness is great above the heavens. Your faithfulness reaches to the skies.

title: Psalms 108:5
content: 5 Be exalted, God, above the heavens! Let your glory be over all the earth.

title: Psalms 108:6
content: 6 That your beloved may be delivered, save with your right hand, and answer us.

title: Psalms 108:7
content: 7 God has spoken from his sanctuary: “In triumph, I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.

title: Psalms 108:8
content: 8 Gilead is mine. Manasseh is mine. Ephraim also is my helmet. Judah is my scepter.

title: Psalms 108:9
content: 9 Moab is my wash pot. I will toss my sandal on Edom. I will shout over Philistia.”

title: Psalms 108:10
content: 10 Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

title: Psalms 108:11
content: 11 Haven’t you rejected us, God? You don’t go out, God, with our armies.

title: Psalms 108:12
content: 12 Give us help against the enemy, for the help of man is vain.

title: Psalms 108:13
content: 13 Through God, we will do valiantly, for it is he who will tread down our enemies.

title: Psalms 109:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. God of my praise, don’t remain silent,

title: Psalms 109:2
content: 2 for they have opened the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit against me. They have spoken to me with a lying tongue.

title: Psalms 109:3
content: 3 They have also surrounded me with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

title: Psalms 109:4
content: 4 In return for my love, they are my adversaries; but I am in prayer.

title: Psalms 109:5
content: 5 They have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

title: Psalms 109:6
content: 6 Set a wicked man over him. Let an adversary stand at his right hand.

title: Psalms 109:7
content: 7 When he is judged, let him come out guilty. Let his prayer be turned into sin.

title: Psalms 109:8
content: 8 Let his days be few. Let another take his office.

title: Psalms 109:9
content: 9 Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

title: Psalms 109:10
content: 10 Let his children be wandering beggars. Let them be sought from their ruins.

title: Psalms 109:11
content: 11 Let the creditor seize all that he has. Let strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.

title: Psalms 109:12
content: 12 Let there be no one to extend kindness to him, neither let there be anyone to have pity on his fatherless children.

title: Psalms 109:13
content: 13 Let his posterity be cut off. In the generation following let their name be blotted out.

title: Psalms 109:14
content: 14 Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered by the LORD. Don’t let the sin of his mother be blotted out.

title: Psalms 109:15
content: 15 Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off their memory from the earth;

title: Psalms 109:16
content: 16 because he didn’t remember to show kindness, but persecuted the poor and needy man, the broken in heart, to kill them.

title: Psalms 109:17
content: 17 Yes, he loved cursing, and it came to him. He didn’t delight in blessing, and it was far from him.

title: Psalms 109:18
content: 18 He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment. It came into his inward parts like water, like oil into his bones.

title: Psalms 109:19
content: 19 Let it be to him as the clothing with which he covers himself, for the belt that is always around him.

title: Psalms 109:20
content: 20 This is the reward of my adversaries from the LORD, of those who speak evil against my soul.

title: Psalms 109:21
content: 21 But deal with me, GOD the Lord, for your name’s sake, because your loving kindness is good, deliver me;

title: Psalms 109:22
content: 22 for I am poor and needy. My heart is wounded within me.

title: Psalms 109:23
content: 23 I fade away like an evening shadow. I am shaken off like a locust.

title: Psalms 109:24
content: 24 My knees are weak through fasting. My body is thin and lacks fat.

title: Psalms 109:25
content: 25 I have also become a reproach to them. When they see me, they shake their head.

title: Psalms 109:26
content: 26 Help me, LORD, my God. Save me according to your loving kindness;

title: Psalms 109:27
content: 27 that they may know that this is your hand; that you, LORD, have done it.

title: Psalms 109:28
content: 28 They may curse, but you bless. When they arise, they will be shamed, but your servant shall rejoice.

title: Psalms 109:29
content: 29 Let my adversaries be clothed with dishonor. Let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.

title: Psalms 109:30
content: 30 I will give great thanks to the LORD with my mouth. Yes, I will praise him among the multitude.

title: Psalms 109:31
content: 31 For he will stand at the right hand of the needy, to save him from those who judge his soul.

title: Psalms 110:1
content: 1 A Psalm by David. The LORD says to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool for your feet.”

title: Psalms 110:2
content: 2 The LORD will send out the rod of your strength out of Zion. Rule among your enemies.

title: Psalms 110:3
content: 3 Your people offer themselves willingly in the day of your power, in holy array. Out of the womb of the morning, you have the dew of your youth.

title: Psalms 110:4
content: 4 The LORD has sworn, and will not change his mind: “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”

title: Psalms 110:5
content: 5 The Lord is at your right hand. He will crush kings in the day of his wrath.

title: Psalms 110:6
content: 6 He will judge among the nations. He will heap up dead bodies. He will crush the ruler of the whole earth.

title: Psalms 110:7
content: 7 He will drink of the brook on the way; therefore he will lift up his head.

title: Psalms 111:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! I will give thanks to the LORD with my whole heart, in the council of the upright, and in the congregation.

title: Psalms 111:2
content: 2 The LORD’s works are great, pondered by all those who delight in them.

title: Psalms 111:3
content: 3 His work is honor and majesty. His righteousness endures forever.

title: Psalms 111:4
content: 4 He has caused his wonderful works to be remembered. The LORD is gracious and merciful.

title: Psalms 111:5
content: 5 He has given food to those who fear him. He always remembers his covenant.

title: Psalms 111:6
content: 6 He has shown his people the power of his works, in giving them the heritage of the nations.

title: Psalms 111:7
content: 7 The works of his hands are truth and justice. All his precepts are sure.

title: Psalms 111:8
content: 8 They are established forever and ever. They are done in truth and uprightness.

title: Psalms 111:9
content: 9 He has sent redemption to his people. He has ordained his covenant forever. His name is holy and awesome!

title: Psalms 111:10
content: 10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom. All those who do his work have a good understanding. His praise endures forever!

title: Psalms 112:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Blessed is the man who fears the LORD, who delights greatly in his commandments.

title: Psalms 112:2
content: 2 His offspring will be mighty in the land. The generation of the upright will be blessed.

title: Psalms 112:3
content: 3 Wealth and riches are in his house. His righteousness endures forever.

title: Psalms 112:4
content: 4 Light dawns in the darkness for the upright, gracious, merciful, and righteous.

title: Psalms 112:5
content: 5 It is well with the man who deals graciously and lends. He will maintain his cause in judgment.

title: Psalms 112:6
content: 6 For he will never be shaken. The righteous will be remembered forever.

title: Psalms 112:7
content: 7 He will not be afraid of evil news. His heart is steadfast, trusting in the LORD.

title: Psalms 112:8
content: 8 His heart is established. He will not be afraid in the end when he sees his adversaries.

title: Psalms 112:9
content: 9 He has dispersed, he has given to the poor. His righteousness endures forever. His horn will be exalted with honor.

title: Psalms 112:10
content: 10 The wicked will see it, and be grieved. He shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away. The desire of the wicked will perish.

title: Psalms 113:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Praise, you servants of the LORD, praise the LORD’s name.

title: Psalms 113:2
content: 2 Blessed be the LORD’s name, from this time forward and forever more.

title: Psalms 113:3
content: 3 From the rising of the sun to its going down, the LORD’s name is to be praised.

title: Psalms 113:4
content: 4 The LORD is high above all nations, his glory above the heavens.

title: Psalms 113:5
content: 5 Who is like the LORD, our God, who has his seat on high,

title: Psalms 113:6
content: 6 who stoops down to see in heaven and in the earth?

title: Psalms 113:7
content: 7 He raises up the poor out of the dust, and lifts up the needy from the ash heap,

title: Psalms 113:8
content: 8 that he may set him with princes, even with the princes of his people.

title: Psalms 113:9
content: 9 He settles the barren woman in her home as a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 114:1
content: 1 When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of foreign language,

title: Psalms 114:2
content: 2 Judah became his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

title: Psalms 114:3
content: 3 The sea saw it, and fled. The Jordan was driven back.

title: Psalms 114:4
content: 4 The mountains skipped like rams, the little hills like lambs.

title: Psalms 114:5
content: 5 What was it, you sea, that you fled? You Jordan, that you turned back?

title: Psalms 114:6
content: 6 You mountains, that you skipped like rams? You little hills, like lambs?

title: Psalms 114:7
content: 7 Tremble, you earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,

title: Psalms 114:8
content: 8 who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a spring of waters.

title: Psalms 115:1
content: 1 Not to us, LORD, not to us, but to your name give glory, for your loving kindness, and for your truth’s sake.

title: Psalms 115:2
content: 2 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God, now?”

title: Psalms 115:3
content: 3 But our God is in the heavens. He does whatever he pleases.

title: Psalms 115:4
content: 4 Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

title: Psalms 115:5
content: 5 They have mouths, but they don’t speak. They have eyes, but they don’t see.

title: Psalms 115:6
content: 6 They have ears, but they don’t hear. They have noses, but they don’t smell.

title: Psalms 115:7
content: 7 They have hands, but they don’t feel. They have feet, but they don’t walk, neither do they speak through their throat.

title: Psalms 115:8
content: 8 Those who make them will be like them; yes, everyone who trusts in them.

title: Psalms 115:9
content: 9 Israel, trust in the LORD! He is their help and their shield.

title: Psalms 115:10
content: 10 House of Aaron, trust in the LORD! He is their help and their shield.

title: Psalms 115:11
content: 11 You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their help and their shield.

title: Psalms 115:12
content: 12 The LORD remembers us. He will bless us. He will bless the house of Israel. He will bless the house of Aaron.

title: Psalms 115:13
content: 13 He will bless those who fear the LORD, both small and great.

title: Psalms 115:14
content: 14 May the LORD increase you more and more, you and your children.

title: Psalms 115:15
content: 15 Blessed are you by the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 115:16
content: 16 The heavens are the LORD’s heavens, but he has given the earth to the children of men.

title: Psalms 115:17
content: 17 The dead don’t praise the LORD, nor any who go down into silence,

title: Psalms 115:18
content: 18 but we will bless the LORD, from this time forward and forever more. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 116:1
content: 1 I love the LORD, because he listens to my voice, and my cries for mercy.

title: Psalms 116:2
content: 2 Because he has turned his ear to me, therefore I will call on him as long as I live.

title: Psalms 116:3
content: 3 The cords of death surrounded me, the pains of Sheol got a hold of me. I found trouble and sorrow.

title: Psalms 116:4
content: 4 Then I called on the LORD’s name: “LORD, I beg you, deliver my soul.”

title: Psalms 116:5
content: 5 The LORD is gracious and righteous. Yes, our God is merciful.

title: Psalms 116:6
content: 6 The LORD preserves the simple. I was brought low, and he saved me.

title: Psalms 116:7
content: 7 Return to your rest, my soul, for the LORD has dealt bountifully with you.

title: Psalms 116:8
content: 8 For you have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

title: Psalms 116:9
content: 9 I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.

title: Psalms 116:10
content: 10 I believed, therefore I said, “I was greatly afflicted.”

title: Psalms 116:11
content: 11 I said in my haste, “All people are liars.”

title: Psalms 116:12
content: 12 What will I give to the LORD for all his benefits toward me?

title: Psalms 116:13
content: 13 I will take the cup of salvation, and call on the LORD’s name.

title: Psalms 116:14
content: 14 I will pay my vows to the LORD, yes, in the presence of all his people.

title: Psalms 116:15
content: 15 Precious in the LORD’s sight is the death of his saints.

title: Psalms 116:16
content: 16 LORD, truly I am your servant. I am your servant, the son of your servant girl. You have freed me from my chains.

title: Psalms 116:17
content: 17 I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call on the LORD’s name.

title: Psalms 116:18
content: 18 I will pay my vows to the LORD, yes, in the presence of all his people,

title: Psalms 116:19
content: 19 in the courts of the LORD’s house, in the middle of you, Jerusalem. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 117:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD, all you nations! Extol him, all you peoples!

title: Psalms 117:2
content: 2 For his loving kindness is great toward us. The LORD’s faithfulness endures forever. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 118:1
content: 1 Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 118:2
content: 2 Let Israel now say that his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 118:3
content: 3 Let the house of Aaron now say that his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 118:4
