content: 4 Now let those who fear the LORD say that his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 118:5
content: 5 Out of my distress, I called on the LORD. The LORD answered me with freedom.

title: Psalms 118:6
content: 6 The LORD is on my side. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

title: Psalms 118:7
content: 7 The LORD is on my side among those who help me. Therefore I will look in triumph at those who hate me.

title: Psalms 118:8
content: 8 It is better to take refuge in the LORD, than to put confidence in man.

title: Psalms 118:9
content: 9 It is better to take refuge in the LORD, than to put confidence in princes.

title: Psalms 118:10
content: 10 All the nations surrounded me, but in the LORD’s name I cut them off.

title: Psalms 118:11
content: 11 They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me. In the LORD’s name I indeed cut them off.

title: Psalms 118:12
content: 12 They surrounded me like bees. They are quenched like the burning thorns. In the LORD’s name I cut them off.

title: Psalms 118:13
content: 13 You pushed me back hard, to make me fall, but the LORD helped me.

title: Psalms 118:14
content: 14 The LORD is my strength and song. He has become my salvation.

title: Psalms 118:15
content: 15 The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous. “The right hand of the LORD does valiantly.

title: Psalms 118:16
content: 16 The right hand of the LORD is exalted! The right hand of the LORD does valiantly!”

title: Psalms 118:17
content: 17 I will not die, but live, and declare the LORD’s works.

title: Psalms 118:18
content: 18 The LORD has punished me severely, but he has not given me over to death.

title: Psalms 118:19
content: 19 Open to me the gates of righteousness. I will enter into them. I will give thanks to the LORD.

title: Psalms 118:20
content: 20 This is the gate of the LORD; the righteous will enter into it.

title: Psalms 118:21
content: 21 I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me, and have become my salvation.

title: Psalms 118:22
content: 22 The stone which the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.

title: Psalms 118:23
content: 23 This is the LORD’s doing. It is marvelous in our eyes.

title: Psalms 118:24
content: 24 This is the day that the LORD has made. We will rejoice and be glad in it!

title: Psalms 118:25
content: 25 Save us now, we beg you, LORD! LORD, we beg you, send prosperity now.

title: Psalms 118:26
content: 26 Blessed is he who comes in the LORD’s name! We have blessed you out of the LORD’s house.

title: Psalms 118:27
content: 27 The LORD is God, and he has given us light. Bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

title: Psalms 118:28
content: 28 You are my God, and I will give thanks to you. You are my God, I will exalt you.

title: Psalms 118:29
content: 29 Oh give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 119:1
content: 1 ALEPH BETH GIMEL DALETH HE VAV ZAYIN HETH TETH YODH KAPF LAMEDH MEM NUN SAMEKH AYIN PE TZADHE QOPH RESH SIN AND SHIN TAV; Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, who walk according to the LORD’s law.

title: Psalms 119:2
content: 2 Blessed are those who keep his statutes, who seek him with their whole heart.

title: Psalms 119:3
content: 3 Yes, they do nothing wrong. They walk in his ways.

title: Psalms 119:4
content: 4 You have commanded your precepts, that we should fully obey them.

title: Psalms 119:5
content: 5 Oh that my ways were steadfast to obey your statutes!

title: Psalms 119:6
content: 6 Then I wouldn’t be disappointed, when I consider all of your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:7
content: 7 I will give thanks to you with uprightness of heart, when I learn your righteous judgments.

title: Psalms 119:8
content: 8 I will observe your statutes. Don’t utterly forsake me.

title: Psalms 119:9
content: 9 How can a young man keep his way pure? By living according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:10
content: 10 With my whole heart I have sought you. Don’t let me wander from your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:11
content: 11 I have hidden your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you.

title: Psalms 119:12
content: 12 Blessed are you, LORD. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:13
content: 13 With my lips, I have declared all the ordinances of your mouth.

title: Psalms 119:14
content: 14 I have rejoiced in the way of your testimonies, as much as in all riches.

title: Psalms 119:15
content: 15 I will meditate on your precepts, and consider your ways.

title: Psalms 119:16
content: 16 I will delight myself in your statutes. I will not forget your word.

title: Psalms 119:17
content: 17 Do good to your servant. I will live and I will obey your word.

title: Psalms 119:18
content: 18 Open my eyes, that I may see wondrous things out of your law.

title: Psalms 119:19
content: 19 I am a stranger on the earth. Don’t hide your commandments from me.

title: Psalms 119:20
content: 20 My soul is consumed with longing for your ordinances at all times.

title: Psalms 119:21
content: 21 You have rebuked the proud who are cursed, who wander from your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:22
content: 22 Take reproach and contempt away from me, for I have kept your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:23
content: 23 Though princes sit and slander me, your servant will meditate on your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:24
content: 24 Indeed your statutes are my delight, and my counselors.

title: Psalms 119:25
content: 25 My soul is laid low in the dust. Revive me according to your word!

title: Psalms 119:26
content: 26 I declared my ways, and you answered me. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:27
content: 27 Let me understand the teaching of your precepts! Then I will meditate on your wondrous works.

title: Psalms 119:28
content: 28 My soul is weary with sorrow; strengthen me according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:29
content: 29 Keep me from the way of deceit. Grant me your law graciously!

title: Psalms 119:30
content: 30 I have chosen the way of truth. I have set your ordinances before me.

title: Psalms 119:31
content: 31 I cling to your statutes, LORD. Don’t let me be disappointed.

title: Psalms 119:32
content: 32 I run in the path of your commandments, for you have set my heart free.

title: Psalms 119:33
content: 33 Teach me, LORD, the way of your statutes. I will keep them to the end.

title: Psalms 119:34
content: 34 Give me understanding, and I will keep your law. Yes, I will obey it with my whole heart.

title: Psalms 119:35
content: 35 Direct me in the path of your commandments, for I delight in them.

title: Psalms 119:36
content: 36 Turn my heart toward your statutes, not toward selfish gain.

title: Psalms 119:37
content: 37 Turn my eyes away from looking at worthless things. Revive me in your ways.

title: Psalms 119:38
content: 38 Fulfill your promise to your servant, that you may be feared.

title: Psalms 119:39
content: 39 Take away my disgrace that I dread, for your ordinances are good.

title: Psalms 119:40
content: 40 Behold, I long for your precepts! Revive me in your righteousness.

title: Psalms 119:41
content: 41 Let your loving kindness also come to me, LORD, your salvation, according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:42
content: 42 So I will have an answer for him who reproaches me, for I trust in your word.

title: Psalms 119:43
content: 43 Don’t snatch the word of truth out of my mouth, for I put my hope in your ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:44
content: 44 So I will obey your law continually, forever and ever.

title: Psalms 119:45
content: 45 I will walk in liberty, for I have sought your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:46
content: 46 I will also speak of your statutes before kings, and will not be disappointed.

title: Psalms 119:47
content: 47 I will delight myself in your commandments, because I love them.

title: Psalms 119:48
content: 48 I reach out my hands for your commandments, which I love. I will meditate on your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:49
content: 49 Remember your word to your servant, because you gave me hope.

title: Psalms 119:50
content: 50 This is my comfort in my affliction, for your word has revived me.

title: Psalms 119:51
content: 51 The arrogant mock me excessively, but I don’t swerve from your law.

title: Psalms 119:52
content: 52 I remember your ordinances of old, LORD, and have comforted myself.

title: Psalms 119:53
content: 53 Indignation has taken hold on me, because of the wicked who forsake your law.

title: Psalms 119:54
content: 54 Your statutes have been my songs in the house where I live.

title: Psalms 119:55
content: 55 I have remembered your name, LORD, in the night, and I obey your law.

title: Psalms 119:56
content: 56 This is my way, that I keep your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:57
content: 57 The LORD is my portion. I promised to obey your words.

title: Psalms 119:58
content: 58 I sought your favor with my whole heart. Be merciful to me according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:59
content: 59 I considered my ways, and turned my steps to your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:60
content: 60 I will hurry, and not delay, to obey your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:61
content: 61 The ropes of the wicked bind me, but I won’t forget your law.

title: Psalms 119:62
content: 62 At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you, because of your righteous ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:63
content: 63 I am a friend of all those who fear you, of those who observe your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:64
content: 64 The earth is full of your loving kindness, LORD. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:65
content: 65 You have treated your servant well, according to your word, LORD.

title: Psalms 119:66
content: 66 Teach me good judgment and knowledge, for I believe in your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:67
content: 67 Before I was afflicted, I went astray; but now I observe your word.

title: Psalms 119:68
content: 68 You are good, and do good. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:69
content: 69 The proud have smeared a lie upon me. With my whole heart, I will keep your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:70
content: 70 Their heart is as callous as the fat, but I delight in your law.

title: Psalms 119:71
content: 71 It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I may learn your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:72
content: 72 The law of your mouth is better to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.

title: Psalms 119:73
content: 73 Your hands have made me and formed me. Give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:74
content: 74 Those who fear you will see me and be glad, because I have put my hope in your word.

title: Psalms 119:75
content: 75 LORD, I know that your judgments are righteous, that in faithfulness you have afflicted me.

title: Psalms 119:76
content: 76 Please let your loving kindness be for my comfort, according to your word to your servant.

title: Psalms 119:77
content: 77 Let your tender mercies come to me, that I may live; for your law is my delight.

title: Psalms 119:78
content: 78 Let the proud be disappointed, for they have overthrown me wrongfully. I will meditate on your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:79
content: 79 Let those who fear you turn to me. They will know your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:80
content: 80 Let my heart be blameless toward your decrees, that I may not be disappointed.

title: Psalms 119:81
content: 81 My soul faints for your salvation. I hope in your word.

title: Psalms 119:82
content: 82 My eyes fail for your word. I say, “When will you comfort me?”

title: Psalms 119:83
content: 83 For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke. I don’t forget your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:84
content: 84 How many are the days of your servant? When will you execute judgment on those who persecute me?

title: Psalms 119:85
content: 85 The proud have dug pits for me, contrary to your law.

title: Psalms 119:86
content: 86 All of your commandments are faithful. They persecute me wrongfully. Help me!

title: Psalms 119:87
content: 87 They had almost wiped me from the earth, but I didn’t forsake your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:88
content: 88 Preserve my life according to your loving kindness, so I will obey the statutes of your mouth.

title: Psalms 119:89
content: 89 LORD, your word is settled in heaven forever.

title: Psalms 119:90
content: 90 Your faithfulness is to all generations. You have established the earth, and it remains.

title: Psalms 119:91
content: 91 Your laws remain to this day, for all things serve you.

title: Psalms 119:92
content: 92 Unless your law had been my delight, I would have perished in my affliction.

title: Psalms 119:93
content: 93 I will never forget your precepts, for with them, you have revived me.

title: Psalms 119:94
content: 94 I am yours. Save me, for I have sought your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:95
content: 95 The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me. I will consider your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:96
content: 96 I have seen a limit to all perfection, but your commands are boundless.

title: Psalms 119:97
content: 97 How I love your law! It is my meditation all day.

title: Psalms 119:98
content: 98 Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, for your commandments are always with me.

title: Psalms 119:99
content: 99 I have more understanding than all my teachers, for your testimonies are my meditation.

title: Psalms 119:100
content: 100 I understand more than the aged, because I have kept your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:101
content: 101 I have kept my feet from every evil way, that I might observe your word.

title: Psalms 119:102
content: 102 I have not turned away from your ordinances, for you have taught me.

title: Psalms 119:103
content: 103 How sweet are your promises to my taste, more than honey to my mouth!

title: Psalms 119:104
content: 104 Through your precepts, I get understanding; therefore I hate every false way.

title: Psalms 119:105
content: 105 Your word is a lamp to my feet, and a light for my path.

title: Psalms 119:106
content: 106 I have sworn, and have confirmed it, that I will obey your righteous ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:107
content: 107 I am afflicted very much. Revive me, LORD, according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:108
content: 108 Accept, I beg you, the willing offerings of my mouth. LORD, teach me your ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:109
content: 109 My soul is continually in my hand, yet I won’t forget your law.

title: Psalms 119:110
content: 110 The wicked have laid a snare for me, yet I haven’t gone astray from your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:111
content: 111 I have taken your testimonies as a heritage forever, for they are the joy of my heart.

title: Psalms 119:112
content: 112 I have set my heart to perform your statutes forever, even to the end.

title: Psalms 119:113
content: 113 I hate double-minded men, but I love your law.

title: Psalms 119:114
content: 114 You are my hiding place and my shield. I hope in your word.

title: Psalms 119:115
content: 115 Depart from me, you evildoers, that I may keep the commandments of my God.

title: Psalms 119:116
content: 116 Uphold me according to your word, that I may live. Let me not be ashamed of my hope.

title: Psalms 119:117
content: 117 Hold me up, and I will be safe, and will have respect for your statutes continually.

title: Psalms 119:118
content: 118 You reject all those who stray from your statutes, for their deceit is in vain.

title: Psalms 119:119
content: 119 You put away all the wicked of the earth like dross. Therefore I love your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:120
content: 120 My flesh trembles for fear of you. I am afraid of your judgments.

title: Psalms 119:121
content: 121 I have done what is just and righteous. Don’t leave me to my oppressors.

title: Psalms 119:122
content: 122 Ensure your servant’s well-being. Don’t let the proud oppress me.

title: Psalms 119:123
content: 123 My eyes fail looking for your salvation, for your righteous word.

title: Psalms 119:124
content: 124 Deal with your servant according to your loving kindness. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:125
content: 125 I am your servant. Give me understanding, that I may know your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:126
content: 126 It is time to act, LORD, for they break your law.

title: Psalms 119:127
content: 127 Therefore I love your commandments more than gold, yes, more than pure gold.

title: Psalms 119:128
content: 128 Therefore I consider all of your precepts to be right. I hate every false way.

title: Psalms 119:129
content: 129 Your testimonies are wonderful, therefore my soul keeps them.

title: Psalms 119:130
content: 130 The entrance of your words gives light. It gives understanding to the simple.

title: Psalms 119:131
content: 131 I opened my mouth wide and panted, for I longed for your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:132
content: 132 Turn to me, and have mercy on me, as you always do to those who love your name.

title: Psalms 119:133
content: 133 Establish my footsteps in your word. Don’t let any iniquity have dominion over me.

title: Psalms 119:134
content: 134 Redeem me from the oppression of man, so I will observe your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:135
content: 135 Make your face shine on your servant. Teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:136
content: 136 Streams of tears run down my eyes, because they don’t observe your law.

title: Psalms 119:137
content: 137 You are righteous, LORD. Your judgments are upright.

title: Psalms 119:138
content: 138 You have commanded your statutes in righteousness. They are fully trustworthy.

title: Psalms 119:139
content: 139 My zeal wears me out, because my enemies ignore your words.

title: Psalms 119:140
content: 140 Your promises have been thoroughly tested, and your servant loves them.

title: Psalms 119:141
content: 141 I am small and despised. I don’t forget your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:142
content: 142 Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness. Your law is truth.

title: Psalms 119:143
content: 143 Trouble and anguish have taken hold of me. Your commandments are my delight.

title: Psalms 119:144
content: 144 Your testimonies are righteous forever. Give me understanding, that I may live.

title: Psalms 119:145
content: 145 I have called with my whole heart. Answer me, LORD! I will keep your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:146
content: 146 I have called to you. Save me! I will obey your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:147
content: 147 I rise before dawn and cry for help. I put my hope in your words.

title: Psalms 119:148
content: 148 My eyes stay open through the night watches, that I might meditate on your word.

title: Psalms 119:149
content: 149 Hear my voice according to your loving kindness. Revive me, LORD, according to your ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:150
content: 150 They draw near who follow after wickedness. They are far from your law.

title: Psalms 119:151
content: 151 You are near, LORD. All your commandments are truth.

title: Psalms 119:152
content: 152 Of old I have known from your testimonies, that you have founded them forever.

title: Psalms 119:153
content: 153 Consider my affliction, and deliver me, for I don’t forget your law.

title: Psalms 119:154
content: 154 Plead my cause, and redeem me! Revive me according to your promise.

title: Psalms 119:155
content: 155 Salvation is far from the wicked, for they don’t seek your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:156
content: 156 Great are your tender mercies, LORD. Revive me according to your ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:157
content: 157 Many are my persecutors and my adversaries. I haven’t swerved from your testimonies.

title: Psalms 119:158
content: 158 I look at the faithless with loathing, because they don’t observe your word.

title: Psalms 119:159
content: 159 Consider how I love your precepts. Revive me, LORD, according to your loving kindness.

title: Psalms 119:160
content: 160 All of your words are truth. Every one of your righteous ordinances endures forever.

title: Psalms 119:161
content: 161 Princes have persecuted me without a cause, but my heart stands in awe of your words.

title: Psalms 119:162
content: 162 I rejoice at your word, as one who finds great plunder.

title: Psalms 119:163
content: 163 I hate and abhor falsehood. I love your law.

title: Psalms 119:164
content: 164 Seven times a day, I praise you, because of your righteous ordinances.

title: Psalms 119:165
content: 165 Those who love your law have great peace. Nothing causes them to stumble.

title: Psalms 119:166
content: 166 I have hoped for your salvation, LORD. I have done your commandments.

title: Psalms 119:167
content: 167 My soul has observed your testimonies. I love them exceedingly.

title: Psalms 119:168
content: 168 I have obeyed your precepts and your testimonies, for all my ways are before you.

title: Psalms 119:169
content: 169 Let my cry come before you, LORD. Give me understanding according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:170
content: 170 Let my supplication come before you. Deliver me according to your word.

title: Psalms 119:171
content: 171 Let my lips utter praise, for you teach me your statutes.

title: Psalms 119:172
content: 172 Let my tongue sing of your word, for all your commandments are righteousness.

title: Psalms 119:173
content: 173 Let your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen your precepts.

title: Psalms 119:174
content: 174 I have longed for your salvation, LORD. Your law is my delight.

title: Psalms 119:175
content: 175 Let my soul live, that I may praise you. Let your ordinances help me.

title: Psalms 119:176
content: 176 I have gone astray like a lost sheep. Seek your servant, for I don’t forget your commandments.

title: Psalms 120:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. In my distress, I cried to the LORD. He answered me.

title: Psalms 120:2
content: 2 Deliver my soul, LORD, from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue.

title: Psalms 120:3
content: 3 What will be given to you, and what will be done more to you, you deceitful tongue?

title: Psalms 120:4
content: 4 Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of juniper.

title: Psalms 120:5
content: 5 Woe is me, that I live in Meshech, that I dwell among the tents of Kedar!

title: Psalms 120:6
content: 6 My soul has had her dwelling too long with him who hates peace.

title: Psalms 120:7
content: 7 I am for peace, but when I speak, they are for war.

title: Psalms 121:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. I will lift up my eyes to the hills. Where does my help come from?

title: Psalms 121:2
content: 2 My help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 121:3
content: 3 He will not allow your foot to be moved. He who keeps you will not slumber.

title: Psalms 121:4
content: 4 Behold, he who keeps Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.

title: Psalms 121:5
content: 5 The LORD is your keeper. The LORD is your shade on your right hand.

title: Psalms 121:6
content: 6 The sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night.

title: Psalms 121:7
content: 7 The LORD will keep you from all evil. He will keep your soul.

title: Psalms 121:8
content: 8 The LORD will keep your going out and your coming in, from this time forward, and forever more.

title: Psalms 122:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. By David. I was glad when they said to me, “Let’s go to the LORD’s house!”

title: Psalms 122:2
content: 2 Our feet are standing within your gates, Jerusalem!

title: Psalms 122:3
content: 3 Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together,

title: Psalms 122:4
content: 4 where the tribes go up, even the LORD’s tribes, according to an ordinance for Israel, to give thanks to the LORD’s name.

title: Psalms 122:5
content: 5 For there are set thrones for judgment, the thrones of David’s house.

title: Psalms 122:6
content: 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. Those who love you will prosper.

title: Psalms 122:7
content: 7 Peace be within your walls, and prosperity within your palaces.

title: Psalms 122:8
content: 8 For my brothers’ and companions’ sakes, I will now say, “Peace be within you.”

title: Psalms 122:9
content: 9 For the sake of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your good.

title: Psalms 123:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. I lift up my eyes to you, you who sit in the heavens.

title: Psalms 123:2
content: 2 Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the LORD, our God, until he has mercy on us.

title: Psalms 123:3
content: 3 Have mercy on us, LORD, have mercy on us, for we have endured much contempt.

title: Psalms 123:4
content: 4 Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scoffing of those who are at ease, with the contempt of the proud.

title: Psalms 124:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. By David. If it had not been the LORD who was on our side, let Israel now say,

title: Psalms 124:2
content: 2 if it had not been the LORD who was on our side, when men rose up against us,

title: Psalms 124:3
content: 3 then they would have swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us,

title: Psalms 124:4
content: 4 then the waters would have overwhelmed us, the stream would have gone over our soul.

title: Psalms 124:5
content: 5 Then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.

title: Psalms 124:6
content: 6 Blessed be the LORD, who has not given us as a prey to their teeth.

title: Psalms 124:7
content: 7 Our soul has escaped like a bird out of the fowler’s snare. The snare is broken, and we have escaped.

title: Psalms 124:8
content: 8 Our help is in the LORD’s name, who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 125:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. Those who trust in the LORD are as Mount Zion, which can’t be moved, but remains forever.

title: Psalms 125:2
content: 2 As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the LORD surrounds his people from this time forward and forever more.

title: Psalms 125:3
content: 3 For the scepter of wickedness won’t remain over the allotment of the righteous, so that the righteous won’t use their hands to do evil.

title: Psalms 125:4
content: 4 Do good, LORD, to those who are good, to those who are upright in their hearts.

title: Psalms 125:5
content: 5 But as for those who turn away to their crooked ways, the LORD will lead them away with the workers of iniquity. Peace be on Israel.

title: Psalms 126:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. When the LORD brought back those who returned to Zion, we were like those who dream.

title: Psalms 126:2
content: 2 Then our mouth was filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing. Then they said among the nations, “The LORD has done great things for them.”

title: Psalms 126:3
content: 3 The LORD has done great things for us, and we are glad.

title: Psalms 126:4
content: 4 Restore our fortunes again, LORD, like the streams in the Negev.

title: Psalms 126:5
content: 5 Those who sow in tears will reap in joy.

title: Psalms 126:6
content: 6 He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing, will certainly come again with joy, carrying his sheaves.

title: Psalms 127:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. By Solomon. Unless the LORD builds the house, they who build it labor in vain. Unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchman guards it in vain.

title: Psalms 127:2
content: 2 It is vain for you to rise up early, to stay up late, eating the bread of toil, for he gives sleep to his loved ones.

title: Psalms 127:3
content: 3 Behold, children are a heritage of the LORD. The fruit of the womb is his reward.

title: Psalms 127:4
content: 4 As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of youth.

title: Psalms 127:5
content: 5 Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them. They won’t be disappointed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.

title: Psalms 128:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. Blessed is everyone who fears the LORD, who walks in his ways.

title: Psalms 128:2
content: 2 For you will eat the labor of your hands. You will be happy, and it will be well with you.

title: Psalms 128:3
content: 3 Your wife will be as a fruitful vine in the innermost parts of your house, your children like olive shoots around your table.

title: Psalms 128:4
content: 4 Behold, this is how the man who fears the LORD is blessed.

title: Psalms 128:5
content: 5 May the LORD bless you out of Zion, and may you see the good of Jerusalem all the days of your life.

title: Psalms 128:6
content: 6 Yes, may you see your children’s children. Peace be upon Israel.

title: Psalms 129:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up. Let Israel now say:

title: Psalms 129:2
content: 2 many times they have afflicted me from my youth up, yet they have not prevailed against me.

title: Psalms 129:3
content: 3 The plowers plowed on my back. They made their furrows long.

title: Psalms 129:4
content: 4 The LORD is righteous. He has cut apart the cords of the wicked.

title: Psalms 129:5
content: 5 Let them be disappointed and turned backward, all those who hate Zion.

title: Psalms 129:6
content: 6 Let them be as the grass on the housetops, which withers before it grows up,

title: Psalms 129:7
content: 7 with which the reaper doesn’t fill his hand, nor he who binds sheaves, his bosom.

title: Psalms 129:8
content: 8 Neither do those who go by say, “The blessing of the LORD be on you. We bless you in the LORD’s name.”

title: Psalms 130:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. Out of the depths I have cried to you, LORD.

title: Psalms 130:2
content: 2 Lord, hear my voice. Let your ears be attentive to the voice of my petitions.

title: Psalms 130:3
content: 3 If you, LORD, kept a record of sins, Lord, who could stand?

title: Psalms 130:4
content: 4 But there is forgiveness with you, therefore you are feared.

title: Psalms 130:5
content: 5 I wait for the LORD. My soul waits. I hope in his word.

title: Psalms 130:6
content: 6 My soul longs for the Lord more than watchmen long for the morning, more than watchmen for the morning.

title: Psalms 130:7
content: 7 Israel, hope in the LORD, for there is loving kindness with the LORD. Abundant redemption is with him.

title: Psalms 130:8
content: 8 He will redeem Israel from all their sins.

title: Psalms 131:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. By David. LORD, my heart isn’t arrogant, nor my eyes lofty; nor do I concern myself with great matters, or things too wonderful for me.

title: Psalms 131:2
content: 2 Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul, like a weaned child with his mother, like a weaned child is my soul within me.

title: Psalms 131:3
content: 3 Israel, hope in the LORD, from this time forward and forever more.

title: Psalms 132:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. LORD, remember David and all his affliction,

title: Psalms 132:2
content: 2 how he swore to the LORD, and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

title: Psalms 132:3
content: 3 “Surely I will not come into the structure of my house, nor go up into my bed;

title: Psalms 132:4
content: 4 I will not give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids,

title: Psalms 132:5
content: 5 until I find out a place for the LORD, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

title: Psalms 132:6
content: 6 Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah. We found it in the field of Jaar.

title: Psalms 132:7
content: 7 “We will go into his dwelling place. We will worship at his footstool.”

title: Psalms 132:8
content: 8 Arise, LORD, into your resting place, you, and the ark of your strength.

title: Psalms 132:9
content: 9 Let your priests be clothed with righteousness. Let your saints shout for joy!

title: Psalms 132:10
content: 10 For your servant David’s sake, don’t turn away the face of your anointed one.

title: Psalms 132:11
content: 11 The LORD has sworn to David in truth. He will not turn from it: “I will set the fruit of your body on your throne.

title: Psalms 132:12
content: 12 If your children will keep my covenant, my testimony that I will teach them, their children also will sit on your throne forever more.”

title: Psalms 132:13
content: 13 For the LORD has chosen Zion. He has desired it for his habitation.

title: Psalms 132:14
content: 14 “This is my resting place forever. I will live here, for I have desired it.

title: Psalms 132:15
content: 15 I will abundantly bless her provision. I will satisfy her poor with bread.

title: Psalms 132:16
content: 16 I will also clothe her priests with salvation. Her saints will shout aloud for joy.

title: Psalms 132:17
content: 17 I will make the horn of David to bud there. I have ordained a lamp for my anointed.

title: Psalms 132:18
content: 18 I will clothe his enemies with shame, but on himself, his crown will shine.”

title: Psalms 133:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. By David. See how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to live together in unity!

title: Psalms 133:2
content: 2 It is like the precious oil on the head, that ran down on the beard, even Aaron’s beard, that came down on the edge of his robes,

title: Psalms 133:3
content: 3 like the dew of Hermon, that comes down on the hills of Zion; for there the LORD gives the blessing, even life forever more.

title: Psalms 134:1
content: 1 A Song of Ascents. Look! Praise the LORD, all you servants of the LORD, who stand by night in the LORD’s house!

title: Psalms 134:2
content: 2 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 134:3
content: 3 May the LORD bless you from Zion, even he who made heaven and earth.

title: Psalms 135:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD’s name! Praise him, you servants of the LORD,

title: Psalms 135:2
content: 2 you who stand in the LORD’s house, in the courts of our God’s house.

title: Psalms 135:3
content: 3 Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good. Sing praises to his name, for that is pleasant.

title: Psalms 135:4
content: 4 For the LORD has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel for his own possession.

title: Psalms 135:5
content: 5 For I know that the LORD is great, that our Lord is above all gods.

title: Psalms 135:6
content: 6 Whatever the LORD pleased, that he has done, in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps.

title: Psalms 135:7
content: 7 He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightnings with the rain. He brings the wind out of his treasuries.

title: Psalms 135:8
content: 8 He struck the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and animal.

title: Psalms 135:9
content: 9 He sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on all his servants.

title: Psalms 135:10
content: 10 He struck many nations, and killed mighty kings—

title: Psalms 135:11
content: 11 Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan—

title: Psalms 135:12
content: 12 and gave their land for a heritage, a heritage to Israel, his people.

title: Psalms 135:13
content: 13 Your name, LORD, endures forever; your renown, LORD, throughout all generations.

title: Psalms 135:14
content: 14 For the LORD will judge his people and have compassion on his servants.

title: Psalms 135:15
content: 15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.

title: Psalms 135:16
content: 16 They have mouths, but they can’t speak. They have eyes, but they can’t see.

title: Psalms 135:17
content: 17 They have ears, but they can’t hear, neither is there any breath in their mouths.

title: Psalms 135:18
content: 18 Those who make them will be like them, yes, everyone who trusts in them.

title: Psalms 135:19
content: 19 House of Israel, praise the LORD! House of Aaron, praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 135:20
content: 20 House of Levi, praise the LORD! You who fear the LORD, praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 135:21
content: 21 Blessed be the LORD from Zion, who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 136:1
content: 1 Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:2
content: 2 Give thanks to the God of gods, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:3
content: 3 Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:4
content: 4 to him who alone does great wonders, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:5
content: 5 to him who by understanding made the heavens, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:6
content: 6 to him who spread out the earth above the waters, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:7
content: 7 to him who made the great lights, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:8
content: 8 the sun to rule by day, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:9
content: 9 the moon and stars to rule by night, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:10
content: 10 to him who struck down the Egyptian firstborn, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:11
content: 11 and brought out Israel from among them, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:12
content: 12 with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:13
content: 13 to him who divided the Red Sea apart, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:14
content: 14 and made Israel to pass through the middle of it, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:15
content: 15 but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:16
content: 16 to him who led his people through the wilderness, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:17
content: 17 to him who struck great kings, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:18
content: 18 and killed mighty kings, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:19
content: 19 Sihon king of the Amorites, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:20
content: 20 Og king of Bashan, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:21
content: 21 and gave their land as an inheritance, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:22
content: 22 even a heritage to Israel his servant, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:23
content: 23 who remembered us in our low estate, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:24
content: 24 and has delivered us from our adversaries, for his loving kindness endures forever;

title: Psalms 136:25
content: 25 who gives food to every creature, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 136:26
content: 26 Oh give thanks to the God of heaven, for his loving kindness endures forever.

title: Psalms 137:1
content: 1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down. Yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

title: Psalms 137:2
content: 2 On the willows in that land, we hung up our harps.

title: Psalms 137:3
content: 3 For there, those who led us captive asked us for songs. Those who tormented us demanded songs of joy: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”

title: Psalms 137:4
content: 4 How can we sing the LORD’s song in a foreign land?

title: Psalms 137:5
content: 5 If I forget you, Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill.

title: Psalms 137:6
content: 6 Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you, if I don’t prefer Jerusalem above my chief joy.

title: Psalms 137:7
content: 7 Remember, LORD, against the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem, who said, “Raze it! Raze it even to its foundation!”

title: Psalms 137:8
content: 8 Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, he will be happy who repays you, as you have done to us.

title: Psalms 137:9
content: 9 Happy shall he be, who takes and dashes your little ones against the rock.

title: Psalms 138:1
content: 1 By David. I will give you thanks with my whole heart. Before the gods, I will sing praises to you.

title: Psalms 138:2
content: 2 I will bow down toward your holy temple, and give thanks to your Name for your loving kindness and for your truth; for you have exalted your Name and your Word above all.

title: Psalms 138:3
content: 3 In the day that I called, you answered me. You encouraged me with strength in my soul.

title: Psalms 138:4
content: 4 All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, LORD, for they have heard the words of your mouth.

title: Psalms 138:5
content: 5 Yes, they will sing of the ways of the LORD, for the LORD’s glory is great!

title: Psalms 138:6
content: 6 For though the LORD is high, yet he looks after the lowly; but he knows the proud from afar.

title: Psalms 138:7
content: 7 Though I walk in the middle of trouble, you will revive me. You will stretch out your hand against the wrath of my enemies. Your right hand will save me.

title: Psalms 138:8
content: 8 The LORD will fulfill that which concerns me. Your loving kindness, LORD, endures forever. Don’t forsake the works of your own hands.

title: Psalms 139:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. LORD, you have searched me, and you know me.

title: Psalms 139:2
content: 2 You know my sitting down and my rising up. You perceive my thoughts from afar.

title: Psalms 139:3
content: 3 You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.

title: Psalms 139:4
content: 4 For there is not a word on my tongue, but behold, LORD, you know it altogether.

title: Psalms 139:5
content: 5 You hem me in behind and before. You laid your hand on me.

title: Psalms 139:6
content: 6 This knowledge is beyond me. It’s lofty. I can’t attain it.

title: Psalms 139:7
content: 7 Where could I go from your Spirit? Or where could I flee from your presence?

title: Psalms 139:8
content: 8 If I ascend up into heaven, you are there. If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there!

title: Psalms 139:9
content: 9 If I take the wings of the dawn, and settle in the uttermost parts of the sea,

title: Psalms 139:10
content: 10 even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.

title: Psalms 139:11
content: 11 If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me. The light around me will be night,”

title: Psalms 139:12
content: 12 even the darkness doesn’t hide from you, but the night shines as the day. The darkness is like light to you.

title: Psalms 139:13
content: 13 For you formed my inmost being. You knit me together in my mother’s womb.

title: Psalms 139:14
content: 14 I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful. My soul knows that very well.

title: Psalms 139:15
content: 15 My frame wasn’t hidden from you, when I was made in secret, woven together in the depths of the earth.

title: Psalms 139:16
content: 16 Your eyes saw my body. In your book they were all written, the days that were ordained for me, when as yet there were none of them.

title: Psalms 139:17
content: 17 How precious to me are your thoughts, God! How vast is their sum!

title: Psalms 139:18
content: 18 If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I wake up, I am still with you.

title: Psalms 139:19
content: 19 If only you, God, would kill the wicked. Get away from me, you bloodthirsty men!

title: Psalms 139:20
content: 20 For they speak against you wickedly. Your enemies take your name in vain.

title: Psalms 139:21
content: 21 LORD, don’t I hate those who hate you? Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?

title: Psalms 139:22
content: 22 I hate them with perfect hatred. They have become my enemies.

title: Psalms 139:23
content: 23 Search me, God, and know my heart. Try me, and know my thoughts.

title: Psalms 139:24
content: 24 See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the everlasting way.

title: Psalms 140:1
content: 1 For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. Deliver me, LORD, from evil men. Preserve me from violent men:

title: Psalms 140:2
content: 2 those who devise mischief in their hearts. They continually gather themselves together for war.

title: Psalms 140:3
content: 3 They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent. Viper’s poison is under their lips. Selah.

title: Psalms 140:4
content: 4 LORD, keep me from the hands of the wicked. Preserve me from the violent men who have determined to trip my feet.

title: Psalms 140:5
content: 5 The proud have hidden a snare for me, they have spread the cords of a net by the path. They have set traps for me. Selah.

title: Psalms 140:6
content: 6 I said to the LORD, “You are my God.” Listen to the cry of my petitions, LORD.

title: Psalms 140:7
content: 7 LORD, the Lord, the strength of my salvation, you have covered my head in the day of battle.

title: Psalms 140:8
content: 8 LORD, don’t grant the desires of the wicked. Don’t let their evil plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah.

title: Psalms 140:9
content: 9 As for the head of those who surround me, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

title: Psalms 140:10
content: 10 Let burning coals fall on them. Let them be thrown into the fire, into miry pits, from where they never rise.

title: Psalms 140:11
content: 11 An evil speaker won’t be established in the earth. Evil will hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

title: Psalms 140:12
content: 12 I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and justice for the needy.

title: Psalms 140:13
content: 13 Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name. The upright will dwell in your presence.

title: Psalms 141:1
content: 1 A Psalm by David. LORD, I have called on you. Come to me quickly! Listen to my voice when I call to you.

title: Psalms 141:2
content: 2 Let my prayer be set before you like incense; the lifting up of my hands like the evening sacrifice.

title: Psalms 141:3
content: 3 Set a watch, LORD, before my mouth. Keep the door of my lips.

title: Psalms 141:4
content: 4 Don’t incline my heart to any evil thing, to practice deeds of wickedness with men who work iniquity. Don’t let me eat of their delicacies.

title: Psalms 141:5
content: 5 Let the righteous strike me, it is kindness; let him reprove me, it is like oil on the head; don’t let my head refuse it; Yet my prayer is always against evil deeds.

title: Psalms 141:6
content: 6 Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock. They will hear my words, for they are well spoken.

title: Psalms 141:7
content: 7 “As when one plows and breaks up the earth, our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.”

title: Psalms 141:8
content: 8 For my eyes are on you, LORD, the Lord. I take refuge in you. Don’t leave my soul destitute.

title: Psalms 141:9
content: 9 Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, from the traps of the workers of iniquity.

title: Psalms 141:10
content: 10 Let the wicked fall together into their own nets while I pass by.

title: Psalms 142:1
content: 1 A contemplation by David, when he was in the cave. A Prayer. I cry with my voice to the LORD. With my voice, I ask the LORD for mercy.

title: Psalms 142:2
content: 2 I pour out my complaint before him. I tell him my troubles.

title: Psalms 142:3
content: 3 When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, you knew my route. On the path in which I walk, they have hidden a snare for me.

title: Psalms 142:4
content: 4 Look on my right, and see; for there is no one who is concerned for me. Refuge has fled from me. No one cares for my soul.

title: Psalms 142:5
content: 5 I cried to you, LORD. I said, “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.”

title: Psalms 142:6
content: 6 Listen to my cry, for I am in desperate need. Deliver me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.

title: Psalms 142:7
content: 7 Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks to your name. The righteous will surround me, for you will be good to me.

title: Psalms 143:1
content: 1 A Psalm by David. Hear my prayer, LORD. Listen to my petitions. In your faithfulness and righteousness, relieve me.

title: Psalms 143:2
content: 2 Don’t enter into judgment with your servant, for in your sight no man living is righteous.

title: Psalms 143:3
content: 3 For the enemy pursues my soul. He has struck my life down to the ground. He has made me live in dark places, as those who have been long dead.

title: Psalms 143:4
content: 4 Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me. My heart within me is desolate.

title: Psalms 143:5
content: 5 I remember the days of old. I meditate on all your doings. I contemplate the work of your hands.

title: Psalms 143:6
content: 6 I spread out my hands to you. My soul thirsts for you, like a parched land. Selah.

title: Psalms 143:7
content: 7 Hurry to answer me, LORD. My spirit fails. Don’t hide your face from me, so that I don’t become like those who go down into the pit.

title: Psalms 143:8
content: 8 Cause me to hear your loving kindness in the morning, for I trust in you. Cause me to know the way in which I should walk, for I lift up my soul to you.

title: Psalms 143:9
content: 9 Deliver me, LORD, from my enemies. I flee to you to hide me.

title: Psalms 143:10
content: 10 Teach me to do your will, for you are my God. Your Spirit is good. Lead me in the land of uprightness.

title: Psalms 143:11
content: 11 Revive me, LORD, for your name’s sake. In your righteousness, bring my soul out of trouble.

title: Psalms 143:12
content: 12 In your loving kindness, cut off my enemies, and destroy all those who afflict my soul, for I am your servant.

title: Psalms 144:1
content: 1 By David. Blessed be the LORD, my rock, who trains my hands to war, and my fingers to battle—

title: Psalms 144:2
content: 2 my loving kindness, my fortress, my high tower, my deliverer, my shield, and he in whom I take refuge, who subdues my people under me.

title: Psalms 144:3
content: 3 LORD, what is man, that you care for him? Or the son of man, that you think of him?

title: Psalms 144:4
content: 4 Man is like a breath. His days are like a shadow that passes away.

title: Psalms 144:5
content: 5 Part your heavens, LORD, and come down. Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.

title: Psalms 144:6
content: 6 Throw out lightning, and scatter them. Send out your arrows, and rout them.

title: Psalms 144:7
content: 7 Stretch out your hand from above, rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters, out of the hands of foreigners,

title: Psalms 144:8
content: 8 whose mouths speak deceit, whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

title: Psalms 144:9
content: 9 I will sing a new song to you, God. On a ten-stringed lyre, I will sing praises to you.

title: Psalms 144:10
content: 10 You are he who gives salvation to kings, who rescues David, his servant, from the deadly sword.

title: Psalms 144:11
content: 11 Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hands of foreigners, whose mouths speak deceit, whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

title: Psalms 144:12
content: 12 Then our sons will be like well-nurtured plants, our daughters like pillars carved to adorn a palace.

title: Psalms 144:13
content: 13 Our barns are full, filled with all kinds of provision. Our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.

title: Psalms 144:14
content: 14 Our oxen will pull heavy loads. There is no breaking in, and no going away, and no outcry in our streets.

title: Psalms 144:15
content: 15 Happy are the people who are in such a situation. Happy are the people whose God is the LORD.

title: Psalms 145:1
content: 1 A praise psalm by David. I will exalt you, my God, the King. I will praise your name forever and ever.

title: Psalms 145:2
content: 2 Every day I will praise you. I will extol your name forever and ever.

title: Psalms 145:3
content: 3 Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised! His greatness is unsearchable.

title: Psalms 145:4
content: 4 One generation will commend your works to another, and will declare your mighty acts.

title: Psalms 145:5
content: 5 I will meditate on the glorious majesty of your honor, on your wondrous works.

title: Psalms 145:6
content: 6 Men will speak of the might of your awesome acts. I will declare your greatness.

title: Psalms 145:7
content: 7 They will utter the memory of your great goodness, and will sing of your righteousness.

title: Psalms 145:8
content: 8 The LORD is gracious, merciful, slow to anger, and of great loving kindness.

title: Psalms 145:9
content: 9 The LORD is good to all. His tender mercies are over all his works.

title: Psalms 145:10
content: 10 All your works will give thanks to you, LORD. Your saints will extol you.

title: Psalms 145:11
content: 11 They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and talk about your power,

title: Psalms 145:12
content: 12 to make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.

title: Psalms 145:13
content: 13 Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom. Your dominion endures throughout all generations. The LORD is faithful in all his words, and loving in all his deeds.

title: Psalms 145:14
content: 14 The LORD upholds all who fall, and raises up all those who are bowed down.

title: Psalms 145:15
content: 15 The eyes of all wait for you. You give them their food in due season.

title: Psalms 145:16
content: 16 You open your hand, and satisfy the desire of every living thing.

title: Psalms 145:17
content: 17 The LORD is righteous in all his ways, and gracious in all his works.

title: Psalms 145:18
content: 18 The LORD is near to all those who call on him, to all who call on him in truth.

title: Psalms 145:19
content: 19 He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him. He also will hear their cry, and will save them.

title: Psalms 145:20
content: 20 The LORD preserves all those who love him, but he will destroy all the wicked.

title: Psalms 145:21
content: 21 My mouth will speak the praise of the LORD. Let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.

title: Psalms 146:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD, my soul.

title: Psalms 146:2
content: 2 While I live, I will praise the LORD. I will sing praises to my God as long as I exist.

title: Psalms 146:3
content: 3 Don’t put your trust in princes, in a son of man in whom there is no help.

title: Psalms 146:4
content: 4 His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth. In that very day, his thoughts perish.

title: Psalms 146:5
content: 5 Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD, his God,

title: Psalms 146:6
content: 6 who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them; who keeps truth forever;

title: Psalms 146:7
content: 7 who executes justice for the oppressed; who gives food to the hungry. The LORD frees the prisoners.

title: Psalms 146:8
content: 8 The LORD opens the eyes of the blind. The LORD raises up those who are bowed down. The LORD loves the righteous.

title: Psalms 146:9
content: 9 The LORD preserves the foreigners. He upholds the fatherless and widow, but he turns the way of the wicked upside down.

title: Psalms 146:10
content: 10 The LORD will reign forever; your God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 147:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD, for it is good to sing praises to our God; for it is pleasant and fitting to praise him.

title: Psalms 147:2
content: 2 The LORD builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

title: Psalms 147:3
content: 3 He heals the broken in heart, and binds up their wounds.

title: Psalms 147:4
content: 4 He counts the number of the stars. He calls them all by their names.

title: Psalms 147:5
content: 5 Great is our Lord, and mighty in power. His understanding is infinite.

title: Psalms 147:6
content: 6 The LORD upholds the humble. He brings the wicked down to the ground.

title: Psalms 147:7
content: 7 Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving. Sing praises on the harp to our God,

title: Psalms 147:8
content: 8 who covers the sky with clouds, who prepares rain for the earth, who makes grass grow on the mountains.

title: Psalms 147:9
content: 9 He provides food for the livestock, and for the young ravens when they call.

title: Psalms 147:10
content: 10 He doesn’t delight in the strength of the horse. He takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.

title: Psalms 147:11
content: 11 The LORD takes pleasure in those who fear him, in those who hope in his loving kindness.

title: Psalms 147:12
content: 12 Praise the LORD, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!

title: Psalms 147:13
content: 13 For he has strengthened the bars of your gates. He has blessed your children within you.

title: Psalms 147:14
content: 14 He makes peace in your borders. He fills you with the finest of the wheat.

title: Psalms 147:15
content: 15 He sends out his commandment to the earth. His word runs very swiftly.

title: Psalms 147:16
content: 16 He gives snow like wool, and scatters frost like ashes.

title: Psalms 147:17
content: 17 He hurls down his hail like pebbles. Who can stand before his cold?

title: Psalms 147:18
content: 18 He sends out his word, and melts them. He causes his wind to blow, and the waters flow.

title: Psalms 147:19
content: 19 He shows his word to Jacob, his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.

title: Psalms 147:20
content: 20 He has not done this for just any nation. They don’t know his ordinances. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 148:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD from the heavens! Praise him in the heights!

title: Psalms 148:2
content: 2 Praise him, all his angels! Praise him, all his army!

title: Psalms 148:3
content: 3 Praise him, sun and moon! Praise him, all you shining stars!

title: Psalms 148:4
content: 4 Praise him, you heavens of heavens, you waters that are above the heavens.

title: Psalms 148:5
content: 5 Let them praise the LORD’s name, for he commanded, and they were created.

title: Psalms 148:6
content: 6 He has also established them forever and ever. He has made a decree which will not pass away.

title: Psalms 148:7
content: 7 Praise the LORD from the earth, you great sea creatures, and all depths,

title: Psalms 148:8
content: 8 lightning and hail, snow and clouds, stormy wind, fulfilling his word,

title: Psalms 148:9
content: 9 mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,

title: Psalms 148:10
content: 10 wild animals and all livestock, small creatures and flying birds,

title: Psalms 148:11
content: 11 kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all judges of the earth,

title: Psalms 148:12
content: 12 both young men and maidens, old men and children.

title: Psalms 148:13
content: 13 Let them praise the LORD’s name, for his name alone is exalted. His glory is above the earth and the heavens.

title: Psalms 148:14
content: 14 He has lifted up the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints, even of the children of Israel, a people near to him. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 149:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Sing to the LORD a new song, his praise in the assembly of the saints.

title: Psalms 149:2
content: 2 Let Israel rejoice in him who made them. Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

title: Psalms 149:3
content: 3 Let them praise his name in the dance! Let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp!

title: Psalms 149:4
content: 4 For the LORD takes pleasure in his people. He crowns the humble with salvation.

title: Psalms 149:5
content: 5 Let the saints rejoice in honor. Let them sing for joy on their beds.

title: Psalms 149:6
content: 6 May the high praises of God be in their mouths, and a two-edged sword in their hand,

title: Psalms 149:7
content: 7 to execute vengeance on the nations, and punishments on the peoples;

title: Psalms 149:8
content: 8 to bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

title: Psalms 149:9
content: 9 to execute on them the written judgment. All his saints have this honor. Praise the LORD!

title: Psalms 150:1
content: 1 Praise the LORD! Praise God in his sanctuary! Praise him in his heavens for his acts of power!

title: Psalms 150:2
content: 2 Praise him for his mighty acts! Praise him according to his excellent greatness!

title: Psalms 150:3
content: 3 Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet! Praise him with harp and lyre!

title: Psalms 150:4
content: 4 Praise him with tambourine and dancing! Praise him with stringed instruments and flute!

title: Psalms 150:5
content: 5 Praise him with loud cymbals! Praise him with resounding cymbals!

title: Psalms 150:6
content: 6 Let everything that has breath praise the LORD! Praise the LORD!
